Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Social Insights Specialist (Meltwater Specialist)




London, Amsterdam

6 months FTC




About Us: Fractal is a dynamic and innovative AI company that is committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients. We are seeking a highly skilled and proactive Data & Insights Specialist with strong communication and presentation skills to support the adoption and strategic use of Meltwater across our brands and business units. This role is critical in enabling teams to extract actionable insights from social and media intelligence, build and maintain a robust media scorecard, and ensure consistent, high-quality reporting across markets.




Responsibilities:




· Meltwater Enablement & Adoption

Act as the go-to expert for Meltwater, supporting onboarding, training, and day-to-day usage across multiple brands and BUs.
Partner with brand teams to embed Meltwater into their workflows and decision-making processes.
Collaborate with the global Meltwater team and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with Unilever’s insights engine strategy.




· Media Scorecard Development

Lead the creation and refinement of a standardized media scorecard to track brand performance, media impact, and consumer sentiment.
Ensure the scorecard is actionable, scalable, and aligned with business KPIs.




· Insights Generation & Reporting

Conduct daily monitoring and analysis of Meltwater dashboards and alerts.
Deliver timely, insightful reports to brand teams, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities.
Leverage AI-powered summaries and dashboards to streamline reporting.




· Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with Consumer Market Insights, Communications, Digital, and Marketing teams to ensure insights are integrated into strategic planning.
Support the development of use cases and best practices for Meltwater adoption across markets.




Preffered Qualifications:




Background in FMCG or consumer brands
Experience with AI-enabled reporting tools and dashboarding.
Familiarity with Unilever’s digital ecosystem is a pre, while knowledge of GDT capabilities and tools (e.g., Brand DNAi, Smart Briefing) is a plus




Ideal Candidate Profile:




Proven experience in consumer insights, media intelligence, or social listening roles.
Deep familiarity with Meltwater or similar platforms (e.g., Brandwatch, Talkwalker).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into compelling narratives.
Experience working in a matrixed, multinational organization.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Comfortable working independently and driving initiatives across diverse teams.




Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

At Eneco, we're on a mission to be climate neutral by 2035 — not just for ourselves, but for all our customers. Digital innovation plays a key role in achieving this, and our Analytics Platform team is at the heart of that effort. We aim to empower the organization to become truly data- and metric-driven, helping teams measure their impact through actionable KPIs, integrated into our OKR framework.

To support this, we're looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about enabling data-informed decisions across the business. While Power BI is our current visualization platform, we're focused on future-proofing our data landscape and are exploring more scalable and code-first analytics solutions. This is an opportunity to help shape that evolution.




What Will You Do?

As a Data Analyst in the Analytics Platform Team, you will be a key enabler of data-driven decision-making across Eneco and Oxxio. Your role goes beyond dashboards, you will help us drive consistency and clarity in how we measure business outcomes and create reusable, scalable analytics capabilities.




While you will support our existing Power BI infrastructure, your focus will be on building a future-ready analytics environment. You’ll work closely with data professionals, product teams, and business stakeholders to align metrics to our OKRs, improve accessibility to trusted insights, and make sure analytics tools and processes evolve alongside our ambitions.




You Will Be Responsible For:

Enabling the organization to become more metric- and KPI-driven by building robust, scalable analytics solutions.
Supporting the governance and improvement of our current visualization toolset (e.g., workspace structure, permissions, deployment).
Collaborating with IT and other teams to align visualization tools with broader data infrastructure.
Designing and maintaining centralized data models and reporting templates that promote reuse and consistency.
Driving continuous improvement by integrating experimentation methods (e.g., A/B testing) into Power BI-based analytics workflows.
Supporting the rollout of analytics capabilities and best practices across teams through training, documentation, and workshops.
Contributing to the future direction of our analytics platform — including the exploration of BI-as-code or alternative visualization tools.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong analytical skills and a structured approach to building KPI- and OKR-driven reporting.
Experience using Power BI in a professional environment.
Understanding of data modeling and performance optimization for analytics products.
Experience in supporting and enabling others with reporting and data literacy.
Solid communication skills, able to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Experience with Power BI system administration and governance.
Experience with Azure (Data Lake, Synapse) and/or Snowflake.
Familiarity with dbt or similar data modeling tools.
Understanding of CI/CD and automation for BI tools (e.g., PowerShell, REST APIs).
Experience with other BI tools or BI-as-code environments.
Experience in Agile/Scrum/Kanban settings.
Dutch language skills.




This Is Where You’ll Work

You’ll be part of the Analytics Platform team. Working closely with data engineers, analysts, and scientists who build and maintain foundational capabilities for the entire Eneco organization. The team ensures consistency in tooling and best practices while fostering a strong learning culture.

You’ll also be part of the broader Eneco Data & Analytics community, where we support each other’s growth and collaborate across value streams to create business impact.




Who We’re Looking For

A forward-looking Data Analyst who sees tools like Power BI as enablers — not end goals.
Someone who wants to help Eneco evolve toward a mature, scalable, and metrics-focused analytics practice.
A team player who enjoys empowering others and contributing to an enterprise-wide transformation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

The One Planet strategy we are committed to here at Eneco sets an ambitious goal to be climate neutral by 2035. We want to achieve that goal for both us and our clients. To make it happen, we are dedicated to offering our customers innovative digital capabilities and smart solutions. Our team is working towards creating an exceptional online customer experience, through modernizing the Eneco chat, app and web environments. We are striving to deliver a superior digital customer experience that will stimulate and make it easier for our customers to become greener, every day.




What Will You Do?

As a Technical Digital Analyst in our Analytics Platform Team, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across Eneco's business and product teams. We're looking for someone who can proactively support and build on our Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure. You will work closely with stakeholders (e.g. Data Analysts, Product Analysts, Media Specialists, and Product Managers) to deploy, maintain, and optimize analytics solutions (GA4, GTM, GBQ) that support Eneco’s digital transformation.




You Will Be Responsible For

Monitoring, supporting, and maintaining the Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure for Eneco and Oxxio (and other brands on occasion).
Ensuring operational GA4 (configuring, training and supporting colleagues, monitoring) is up to date and running smoothly.
Ensuring operational GTM (client-side and server-side) deployment, optimization, review of workspaces, and tag management is working correctly.
Supporting product and business teams by identifying necessary measurements, reviewing measurement plans, and proposing measurement solutions for our apps, websites and chatbots.
Improving Digital Analytics end-to-end infrastructure.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong understanding of digital analytics concepts, (web/app) tracking, and methodologies
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
Proficient in (server-side) GTM, GA4, Firebase, and user feedback and experimentation tools (e.g., GrowthBook, Optimizely, GetFeedback, Hotjar)
Proficient in writing custom JavaScript (for tagging) and SQL (for querying and analysis)
Experience working with online marketing and advertising pixels (e.g., Google Ads, Affiliates)
Strong understanding of privacy-related topics (e.g., GDPR, Telecommunicatiewet, Consent Mode)
Passionate about knowledge sharing (e.g., documentation, training colleagues, workshops)
Basic statistics knowledge for hypothesis testing




Nice to Have:

Knowledge of data modeling using dbt and Snowflake DWH
Good understanding of data visualization (e.g., Power BI and Google Looker Studio)
Familiarity with Azure, Kubernetes, and Docker
Ability to communicate technical topics clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Dutch language skills are a plus




This is Where You Will Work

You will be working collaboratively with other Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists within the Analytics Platform Team. The team is responsible for maintaining and onboarding all digital analytics and experimentation-related tools. Each specialist focuses on their specific area of specialization to enable value streams to reach their objectives without worrying about the foundational tech infrastructure.




For Digital Analytics, you will not be working alone; instead, you can grow and learn alongside the Senior Digital Analyst. Within the team, we foster a culture of learning, actively encourage proactive collaboration, celebrate successes, and use failures as opportunities for growth and improvement.

Show more

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Als Data Analyst bij DHL eCommerce ben jij de sleutel tot het onderhouden, uitbreiden, rapporteren en analyseren van onze operationele (stuur)informatie. Je zorgt ervoor dat onze informatie altijd accuraat en up-to-date is, zodat we de beste service kunnen bieden aan onze klanten. In een dynamisch netwerk houd je de ontwikkelingen scherp in de gaten, bijvoorbeeld door het begeleiden van aanpassingen in de businesslogica naar aanleiding van wijzigingen in pakketroutes. Je begeleidt de implementatie van nieuwe logicaschema’s door IT. Samen met stakeholders vanuit Operations en Sales breng je nieuwe netwerken in kaart en zorg je ervoor dat deze goed worden geïntegreerd in onze rapportages.


Je rapporteert de informatie die is opgeslagen op het DHL-dataplatform via Microsoft Power BI. Bij complexe vraagstukken bied je ondersteuning en advies en voer je analyses uit in Power BI of Excel om de efficiëntie van onze operaties te verbeteren. Jouw inzichten maken het verschil in onze logistieke processen!


Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je komt te werken op het hoofdkantoor van DHL e-Commerce in Utrecht. Hier maak je deel uit van een jong en dynamisch team van Data Analysts binnen ons Operations-team. We stimuleren samenwerking en innovatie en luisteren altijd naar jouw ideeën en feedback. Bij DHL e-Commerce hechten we veel waarde aan een inclusieve en ondersteunende werkcultuur, waar iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en zich te ontwikkelen.


Dit ben jij

Je hebt ervaring met Microsoft Power BI en Excel en beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden op hbo- of wo-niveau. Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, omdat je regelmatig overleg hebt met stakeholders. Je bent probleemoplossend ingesteld en kunt goed samenwerken met IT-teams en andere afdelingen. Daarnaast ben je leergierig en bereid om nieuwe inzichten te verwerven om onze processen te verbeteren.


Dit krijg jij

  • Een salaris tussen de €3700 - €4000 bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van €0,23 per kilometer, met een maximum tot 30 km enkele reis;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Cao à la carte: een budget dat je kan inzetten voor extra vakantiedagen of salaris;
  • Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden vanaf dag één;
  • Mooie doorgroeikansen binnen de organisatie;
  • De mogelijkheid tot hybride werken.


De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiekbedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, Top Employer 2025 en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!


Solliciteren?

Solliciteer dan nu met je cv en eventueel een motivatiebrief. Heb je vragen over de vacature of wil je meer informatie? Aarzel dan niet om contact op te nemen met Eva Hazes, Corporate Recruiter, via eva.hazes@dhl.com. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Data Analyst


As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Clients, I am seeking for a Data Analyst for a position in Amsterdam, Netherlands. As a Data Analyst for our Operations BI Product Team you will have a large scope and wide stakeholder landscape to keep you always learning something new about airport operations. You will help your stakeholders to fine tune existing KPIs or explore new ones, and align definitions against the vast datasets at your disposal. You will be in the frontline of creating tangible intelligence that will be used in decision making by colleagues ranging from management to those in critical operational roles.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Join the key Business Intelligence team dedicated to support our stakeholders in the Operations Domain with accurate actionable performance dashboards and insights;
  • Understand the business and the potential to optimize their processes and help formulating the most relevant business and analysis questions;
  • Define meaningful KPIs together with business stakeholders and perform data analyses to translate these functional definitions into precise logic and calculations;
  • Explore, assess and validate the data quality and usability of existing and new datasets;
  • Ensure consistent interpretation of KPIs across different stakeholder groups by formalizing and documenting definitions;
  • Act as a bridge between business requirements and BI development (back-end and front-end) to ensure alignment between requirements and end results.


Key Requirements:

  • 3+ years of working in a data team, with meaningful experience in data analytics. Aviation-related experience is a big plus;
  • HBO-level education in engineering, econometrics, sciences, business analytics, or related with a strong quantitative component;
  • Experience in translating business requirements to data products, insights and KPIs;
  • Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders;
  • Comfortable participating in Agile ceremonies and adhering to Scrum processes;
  • Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib. - Knowledge of Streamlit is a plus;
  • Experience working in PowerBI, and familiar with related concepts such as semantic models and DAX;
  • Knowledge of Collibra is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills, including fluency in Dutch and a good working level of English is required.


Contract: 6+ months

Rates: Excellent

Location: Amsterdam

Hours: 32 hours/week

Interview: 2 stages, 1 technical + 1 assessment


Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We Are Social is a global socially-led creative agency with unrivalled social media expertise. With over 15 offices worldwide, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture. We Are Social Amsterdam has been a hub for innovative, impactful creative campaigns driven by cultural and social insights since 2021.

At We Are Social, we foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and adaptability. Our team thrives on pushing boundaries, exploring bold ideas, and delivering work that makes a meaningful impact for leading global brands.

The Opportunity

Are you passionate about managing research projects and delivering compelling, actionable insights?

Do you have a proactive and solution-oriented approach to data?

Are you skilled at designing and implementing research methodologies tailored to specific needs?

We're looking for a data-driven Research & Insights Analyst with hands-on experience using social listening and digital research platforms to lead the design and execution of strategic insight projects. You will work closely with internal teams and clients to recommend suitable research solutions and ensure the quality of deliverables.

Requirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere


Managed research projects, including design, setup, workflow, and resource management.
Mastered research and analytical skills at an advanced level.
Designed and implemented research methodologies tailored to specific needs and contexts.
Stayed updated on platform-specific metrics and changes in the social and digital landscape.
Utilized analytical tools, such as social listening, performance measurement tools, and databases.
Presented and explained findings effectively to diverse audiences, including clients and internal stakeholders.
Developed compelling storytelling based on research insights.
Provided actionable recommendations aligned with business goals.


What Else Are We Looking For?


Advanced knowledge of social listening tools (eg. Brandwatch), and ideally digital research platforms (eg. GWI).
Experience: 3+ years of experience in research, data analysis, or a similar field, preferably within an agency environment.
Passion for the digital world and familiarity with key social networks, such as Instagram, Facebook, X, TikTok, Twitch, YouTube, and Discord.
Proven ability to extract insights from raw aggregated data.
Strong knowledge of Google Workspace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides) as well as Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentations.
A keen eye for detail.
Demonstrates a proactive approach to identifying and exploring new data sources and research methodologies to uncover actionable insights.
Ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.


Benefits

Life at We Are Social Amsterdam

We Are Social Amsterdam Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. We Celebrate Diversity And Inclusion, Ensuring That Everyone Feels Valued And Empowered To Contribute To Our Shared Success. We Offer


Career Path Design: Regular reviews and mentorship to support professional growth.
WAS Passport: Opportunity to work for two weeks per year in any of our global network offices.
Training Programs: Access to professional development initiatives and creative workshops.
Diversity and Wellbeing: Participate in mental health, CSR, and diversity & inclusion activities.
Flexible Working: Up to three remote working days per week.


If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Rotterdam – ALTEN Nederland




De functie




Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Rotterdam.




Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Actief samenwerken met stakeholders om bedrijfsbehoeften te vertalen naar technische analysemogelijkheden
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen ter verbetering van bedrijfsprocessen
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de volledige implementatiecyclus, inclusief requirement gathering, testen en uitrol




Jouw profiel




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevante richting
3–5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Vaardig in SQL, dimensionale modellering en data pipeline ontwikkeling
Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau, Power BI of SAP Analytics Cloud
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: communicatievaardig, analytisch, proactief, leergericht




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?




Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG’s expertise: Profiteer van voortdurende leermogelijkheden, technische communities en kennisdeling, versterkt door de integratie van SDG binnen ALTEN.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN




ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Analyst




Job Description:




As a Data Specialist, you will be responsible for ensuring and enhancing the integrity of aircraft component data across various Engineering & Maintenance systems (such as SAP, Crocos, MXI, and Aeroxchange). Your work plays a crucial role in minimizing safety, financial, and operational risks while helping us maximize the value of component-related data. Through your analysis and recommendations, you will contribute to process improvements and support the implementation of big data solutions, including Predictive Maintenance.




You'll join the Component Services (CS) department, which manages the availability and repair of aircraft components for both KLM and external airline clients. CS is made up of several units working together to deliver efficient and high-quality maintenance processes. You will be part of the Change Development & Support Unit, which focuses on monitoring and optimizing component reliability in close collaboration with Engineering.




Key Responsibilities:

Ensure and Improve Data Integrity:
Measure, analyze, and report on data quality within our systems. Provide recommendations for process improvements based on your findings.
Manage IT Developments:
Assess the impact of IT changes on data quality. Work closely with IT teams to reduce data-related risks and ensure continuity.
Turn Data into Insights:
Leverage your expertise to transform raw data into actionable insights. Support Predictive Maintenance initiatives and identify data correlations to enable more proactive, predictive operations.
Process Optimization and Compliance:
Ensure data handling complies with the highest safety standards. Contribute to greater operational and financial efficiency through smart data practices.




Qualifications:

A higher vocational (HBO+) or academic degree in a relevant field
Fluent in both Dutch and English (written and spoken)
Strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis and reporting
Knowledge of and experience with CS-related business data, systems, and workflows (e.g., SAP, MXI, Crocos)
Affinity with IT/programming (e.g., SAS, scripting languages) and a solid understanding of MRO (Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul) processes
Excellent communication skills, with experience in project management and stakeholder advising

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.









Job Description



Who will you be working with?

The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.



What you are going to do

As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.



Responsibilities include:



Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are



You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need



Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer



Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: EMAT Data Analyst
Description:
PIPECARE Group is currently looking for EMAT Data Analyst to join our team.

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PIPECARE Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced UT/UTCD Integrity Engineer [Level 3] to support our continued growth.

The selected candidate will be working with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results, with a focus on our custom-tailored reporting solutions to satisfy our customers’ needs. This includes the review of customer requirement specifications, processing of in-line inspection data, the analysis and identification of pipeline features and anomalies within processed data sets, application of industry accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the final results, and compiling the results of our inspection activities in a concise, comprehensive custom tailored report for our customers.

Industry/sector: Oil & Gas / In Line Inspection services

Qualification: Certification in EMAT technology [Level 3]

Min years of experience: minimum last 15+ years working as EMAT Data Analyst

Other requirements: solution – oriented attitude; hands on approach; disciplined; team player; self-motivated

Responsibilities include:


Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
Checking the data quality of ILI runs
EMAT Data Analysis (Valid or expired ASNT LIII or LII Certificate)
Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
Reviewing the software inter phase
Reviewing software user manuals
Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
To prepare a specific Run assessment report
To identify obstructions in the pipeline.
To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
To alert the R&D regarding software problems
To update the documentation
To produce and update standard quality procedures
To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding software problems
Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role


Qualified Candidates will possess:


College degree in engineering or related fields.
Database development and implementation experience.
Process analysis, requirement / functional specification development experience.
Quality assurance of databases, reporting experience.
Experience of working on large, complex and multiple databases
Proficient in using analytical tools and instruments, for instance Excel, Microsoft Access, Minitab and SPSS
High ability to work with numbers.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Analytical mind which can process information logically
Professional level of English language


Job requirements:


Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success


Physical and Mental Requirements:


Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary


About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
  • To alert the R&D regarding software problems
  • To update the documentation
  • To produce and update standard quality procedures
  • To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding software problems
  • Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role

Qualified Candidates will possess:

  • College degree in engineering or related fields.
  • Database development and implementation experience.
  • Process analysis, requirement / functional specification development experience.
  • Quality assurance of databases, reporting experience.
  • Experience of working on large, complex and multiple databases
  • Proficient in using analytical tools and instruments, for instance Excel, Microsoft Access, Minitab and SPSS
  • High ability to work with numbers.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Analytical mind which can process information logically
  • Professional level of English language

Job requirements:

  • Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
  • Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
  • Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
  • Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
  • Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success

Physical and Mental Requirements:

  • Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
  • Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
  • Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
  • Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
  • Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
  • Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary

About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Analist
Description:
🇳🇱 Freelance Data Analist (ZZP)

Ben jij een data-specialist met een scherp oog voor detail én een passie voor procesverbetering? In deze freelance opdracht bewaak en verbeter je de integriteit van vliegtuigcomponentgegevens in systemen zoals SAP, MXI en Crocos. Je werkt mee aan het ontwikkelen van datagedreven oplossingen, waaronder Predictive Maintenance, en levert advies dat direct impact heeft op veiligheid, kostenbeheersing en operationele efficiëntie.

Je bent onderdeel van een technische unit die nauw samenwerkt met engineering en verantwoordelijk is voor de beschikbaarheid en betrouwbaarheid van vliegtuigonderdelen.

🔧 Taken & verantwoordelijkheden:

Analyseren en verbeteren van datakwaliteit binnen onderhoudssystemen
Ondersteunen bij IT-veranderingen die impact hebben op dataverwerking
Ontwikkelen van datagedreven inzichten en ondersteuning bij big data-projecten
Identificeren van correlaties voor procesverbetering en risicovermindering
Zorgen voor compliance en veiligheidsnormen in dataverwerking

✅ Jouw profiel:

HBO+ of WO werk- en denkniveau
Ervaring met SAP, MXI, Crocos en luchtvaart/MRO-processen
Affiniteit met scripting of data-analyse tools (bijv. SAS)
Sterk in stakeholdercommunicatie en advisering
Vloeiend in Nederlands én Engels

🇬🇧 Freelance Data Analyst (ZZP)

Looking for a freelance opportunity where your data skills directly impact aviation safety and efficiency? As a Data Analyst, you'll ensure the integrity of aircraft component data across systems such as SAP, MXI, and Crocos. You'll play a key role in optimizing maintenance processes, identifying trends, and enabling predictive solutions in collaboration with engineering teams.

This role is part of a technical unit responsible for the availability and reliability of aircraft components for both internal and external clients.

🔧 Responsibilities:

Monitor and improve data quality across various maintenance systems
Support IT changes that affect data flows and minimize risks
Develop insights and contribute to predictive maintenance initiatives
Identify correlations in data to improve safety and reduce costs
Ensure compliance with data and aviation safety standards

✅ What you bring:

Bachelor’s or Master’s level background in a relevant field
Experience with aviation/MRO systems such as SAP, MXI, or Crocos
Strong analytical skills and hands-on experience with scripting or SAS
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Fluent in both Dutch and English

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Groningen – ALTEN Nederland




De functie




Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Groningen.




Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Actief samenwerken met stakeholders om bedrijfsbehoeften te vertalen naar technische analysemogelijkheden
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen ter verbetering van bedrijfsprocessen
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de volledige implementatiecyclus, inclusief requirement gathering, testen en uitrol




Jouw profiel




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevante richting
3–5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Vaardig in SQL, dimensionale modellering en data pipeline ontwikkeling
Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau, Power BI of SAP Analytics Cloud
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: communicatievaardig, analytisch, proactief, leergericht




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?




Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG’s expertise: Profiteer van voortdurende leermogelijkheden, technische communities en kennisdeling, versterkt door de integratie van SDG binnen ALTEN.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN




ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.



You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.



What you will do



Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.



Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.



Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.



Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.



Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.



Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.



Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.



Within Sia, you will



Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.



Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).



Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.





Qualifications



About You



You bring:



A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.



Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.



Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.



Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.



Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.



Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.



Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.



Your technical toolkit:



Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.



Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.



Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.



Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.







Why Join Us?



Tailored career development with ongoing training in analytics, AI, and consulting skills.



Project diversity: Collaborate on high-impact assignments across sectors and geographies.



Flexibility: Hybrid work model combining office, remote, and client-based work.



Attractive compensation package including annual raises, bonuses, and personalized mobility options.



Global network: Be part of a vibrant international consulting community with thought leaders in AI and analytics.





Additional Information



Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.











Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.

Projecten met maatschappelijke impact en opdrachten die ertoe doen. Uitstekende ontwikkelmogelijkheden, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk. Werken in een bedrijf waar je vrijheid krijgt, maar ook verantwoordelijkheid draagt.




Wie ben jij?

HBO/WO niveau opgeleid
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Uiteraard staat deze vacature open voor iedereen die zich hierin herkent. We geloven dat diversiteit binnen onze teams zorgt voor groei en innovatie.




Wat bieden we jou?

Werken in een organisatie met maatschappelijke relevantie, maar ook met ruimte voor jouw ontwikkeling.
Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – € 5.500 per maand, op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van ervaring.
8% vakantiegeld.
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23/km).
Een laptop en telefoon.
25 vakantiedagen.
De mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen te kopen of verkopen.
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden.
Thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag + vergoeding voor inrichting thuiswerkplek.
Toegang tot onze Academy voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Show more

  • Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.


Uiteraard staat deze vacature open voor iedereen die zich hierin herkent. We geloven dat diversiteit binnen onze teams zorgt voor groei en innovatie.


Wat bieden we jou?

  • Werken in een organisatie met maatschappelijke relevantie, maar ook met ruimte voor jouw ontwikkeling.
  • Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – € 5.500 per maand, op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van ervaring.
  • 8% vakantiegeld.
  • NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23/km).
  • Een laptop en telefoon.
  • 25 vakantiedagen.
  • De mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen te kopen of verkopen.
  • Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden.
  • Thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag + vergoeding voor inrichting thuiswerkplek.
  • Toegang tot onze Academy voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten, verzamelen, structureren en analyseren van data om inzichten te genereren voor interne en externe klanten. Je ondersteunt besluitvorming met heldere rapportages en visualisaties. Daarnaast richt je systemen in voor de onboarding van nieuwe projecten, zodat datastromen en informatiestromen vanaf de start goed zijn geborgd.

Wat ga je doen?



Je selecteert, analyseert en interpreteert data met behulp van modellen, software en statistische tools.
Je brengt informatiebehoeften in kaart en voert bronanalyses uit in overleg met stakeholders.
Je haalt data op uit databronnen via SQL of andere software en structureert deze in bruikbare formats.
Je bent betrokken bij ontwikkelingen en stemt deze af met o.a. data scientists en business vertegenwoordigers.
Je onderhoudt data in de systemen en databases en lost software- en/of data gerelateerde problemen op.
Je visualiseert data, ontwikkelt dashboards en stelt rapportages op.
Je richt systemen en processen in voor onboarding van nieuwe projecten.
Voor de uitvoering van je werkzaamheden maak je gebruik van SkySpark.



Jouw werkomgeving

Bij BAM Bouw en Techniek – Gebouwservices ligt de focus op het beheren en onderhouden van hoogwaardig vastgoed, met expertise in zowel bouwkundig als installatietechnisch onderhoud. Onze prioriteit is het aangaan van langdurige samenwerkingsverbanden met professionele klanten die streven naar integraal onderhoud en het behoud van de technische levensduur van gebouwen. Onze professionele en gepassioneerde mensen, lerende organisatie en digitale technieken ondersteunen uniforme processen en duurzame onderhoudsstrategieën.

Je komt terecht in het team Commercie & Business Development in Bunnik. Hier werk je samen met data analisten, data scientists, duurzaamheidsadviseurs, onderhoudsdeskundigen en andere specialisten, aan de toekomst van data-gedreven gebouwbeheer. Bij BAM werken we hybride, waardoor je flexibel kunt werken.

Wij bieden jou

Bij BAM investeren we in onze medewerkers en creëren we een positieve, inclusieve werkcultuur. Wij bieden jou de kans om in een innovatief en ambitieus team te werken, met voldoende ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Daarnaast bieden we:



Een salaris tussen de €3.900,- en €5.400,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek (exclusief 8% vakantiegeld).
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden volgens de Bouw & Infra cao, inclusief 25 vakantiedagen en 15 roostervrije dagen per jaar.
Een laptop en iPhone.
Flexibiliteit in werken (hybride werken), wat zorgt voor een goede werk-privébalans.
Mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling via BAM Learning en andere cursussen of trainingen.



Hier herken jij jezelf in

Wij zoeken een Data Analist die analytisch sterk is, communicatief vaardig en in staat om complexe data om te zetten in heldere inzichten.

Daarnaast heb je:



Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van data science, informatica, (technische)bedrijfskunde of een vergelijkbare studie.
Kennis van of ervaring met SQL, Power BI, Excel en bij voorkeur ook met Python of SkySpark.
Affiniteit met beheer & onderhoud, gebouwinstallaties en gebruikerservaring.
Affiniteit met het inrichten van datastructuren en onboardingprocessen voor nieuwe projecten.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen.



Het sollicitatieproces

Heeft deze uitdaging je interesse gewekt en wil je graag meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Lamiae el Boudakhani, corporate recruiter, via telefoon, sms of WhatsApp op 06 – 50 60 18 76, of stuur een e-mail naar lamiae.el.boudakhani@bam.com. Solliciteren is eenvoudig via de sollicitatieknop op deze pagina.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Analyst to support our business in EMEA. Analytics team is focused on building the reporting necessary to measure key performance indicators for Tesla’s sales, delivery and service teams, and increasing efficiency through data and analytics.  

The Analyst will also be tasked to provide proactive analyses helping to drive business programs and informed decisions. The Analyst should act as an advisor, ultimately helping leadership to identify and overcome challenges thereby helping to enhance the productivity of Tesla’s sales, delivery and service organization. The Analyst must be able to clearly communicate insights to the management teams.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement detailed and accurate reports for the management team, providing visibility into performance against key business objectives 
Manipulate and interpret large datasets to deliver actionable insights to the management 
Design intuitive and elegant visualizations to communicate key insights that drive business decisions 
Improve the sales, delivery and service organization’s access to data via improved data generation and processing by partnering with our system analysts teams  
Ensure consistency, reliability and quality of all standard reporting deliverables 
Develop new tools to promote productivity and efficiency utilizing Tableau, SQL, Python and Tesla in-house reporting tools 
Communicate effectively with the regional managers to identify and address areas for improvement 
Build and maintain advanced models to measure, analyze, and forecast key metrics for our business in EMEA 



What You'll Bring


3 - 6 years of relevant experience 
Love for data and translating data into actionable insights 
Highly collaborative and team-oriented, while also able to work independently 
Ability to deliver under tight deadlines and work on multiple tasks and projects at once 
Strong experience with SQL and understanding the dataflow
Experience with Tableau (or similar tooling like MS PowerBI, Qlik) and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with Python is a plus.  
Excellent quantitative skills and a deep understanding of statistical methods with an ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making 
Strong written and verbal communication skills  



, Tesla

Title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (M/F/D)
Description:
We are a community open to everyone. One global team where everyone counts.

Join the Canyon team and work at the cutting edge of the bike industry, with a job as versatile and exciting as the bikes we develop. All in an open, international atmosphere where teamwork, collaboration, true innovation, and a dynamic workplace are all part of our everyday. Ready to ride with us?

THE ROLE

Canyon is a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand – and data is at the heart of how we grow, optimise, and innovate. As a Digital Data Analyst, you'll combine business acumen with deep technical expertise to generate robust analytics, scalable reporting, and actionable insight. You’ll work across Digital, Marketing, Sales, and BI to build analytical products, engineer efficient data pipelines, and enable decision-making at speed and scale.

YOUR JOB AS PART OF THE CANYON CREW


Partner with business stakeholders to scope analytical use cases and deliver structured, data-driven solutions
Analyse KPIs spanning e-commerce performance, customer journeys, traffic acquisition, conversion, and product engagement
Build robust dashboards and scalable reporting tools using data from GA4, CRM, ERP, and marketing platforms
Convey data-driven insights and business recommendations through clear and actionable presentations, up to C-level audience
Develop and maintain performant cloud-based data pipelines to enable reliable access to clean, transformed datasets
Integrate external and internal APIs to enrich existing data sources and improve attribution, segmentation, and targeting
Perform advanced data wrangling, SQL scripting, and transformation tasks across large, complex datasets
Apply statistical techniques and modelling to identify trends, forecast outcomes, and support optimisation initiatives
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation rules, QA processes, and source-to-report consistency checks
Collaborate with Data Engineers and Scientists to evolve our tooling and infrastructure
Evolve into advanced analytics / data science topics (e.g., predictive modelling, experimentation, ML enablement)


How You Become Part Of The Race


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field; please attach diploma
:3–5 years of experience in analytics-heavy roles (e.g. Consultant, Data Analyst, …) with direct technical ownership; please attach references if available
Expert-level SQL and comfort working with cloud platforms (e.g. BigQuery, GCP)
Proficiency in Python or R for scripting, modelling, or data transformation
Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and web analytics (GA4, Adobe, etc.)
Strong understanding of data structures, ETL concepts, and data integration workflows
Sharp analytical thinking, structured problem solving, and a bias for clean, repeatable solutions


HIGHLIGHTS ON YOUR CANYON TOUR

The Canyon Crew 

In our global team, we combine energy and transparency and promote a feedback culture as well as Canyon events, along with inspiring crew rides. Welcome to a career that is more than just a job! 

Feel Canyon  

Unlock your passion for cycling with us! Enjoy exclusive discounts on bikes, gear, and apparel as part of our commitment to fueling your cycling journey. 

Compensation 

Experience a rewarding career with a competitive market-based salary, generous paid time off and we contribute to your private pension scheme as we care for your future. Your satisfaction is our priority as we build a thriving work environment together. 

Working Model 

Join us for a career that prioritizes life-work integration through flexible and hybrid work options. Experience a family-friendly environment where balance is not just a goal but a way of professional life. 

Working Culture 

Be part of our journey in creating an inclusive workplace where your voice matters. Your well-being is our highest priority and together with you we unlock the Canyon spirit. 

Job Variety 

Explore a diverse career path with us, where you can delve into various departments with operational, strategic, creative, or technical roles. Experience a wide range of job opportunities that consistently challenge and inspire you.  

Impact 

Embark on a career shaping the future of mobility in a global environment. Join us as we prioritize innovation, fun and sustainability, always putting our customers first, with the shared goal of building the best bikes for a forward-thinking world.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We offer you an Ocean of Possibilities. Join our family.

About Us

Hop aboard Damen Naval; the naval division of the family-owned Damen Shipyards Group, where 12,000 professionals work worldwide. Damen Naval delivers advanced naval vessels to clients all over the globe. By implementing the most innovative technological developments in practice, we continue to push the boundaries of the shipbuilding industry. You can be part of our team! Are you ready for duty?

The role

As a Data Analyst at Damen Naval, you'll hold a key position in empowering departments and management to make informed, data-driven decisions. Joining our Data Management team within IT, you'll act as a crucial liaison between the business and data management, overseeing the complete data lifecycle from secure gathering to effective leveraging. Your insights will shape the design of next-generation ships, boost internal efficiency, and extend winning deals. Due to the highly sensitive nature of naval shipbuilding, all our data is managed on-premises using SSIS/SSAS and Power BI report server, ensuring a robust and secure environment.

Key Accountabilities

In this role, your responsibilities will include:


Collaborate closely with stakeholders (engineers, project managers, supply chain) to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure robust data governance, including ownership, quality rules, risk profiling, and definition management.
Perform statistical analysis to identify trends and anomalies, then generate compelling reports and visualizations.
Support and train end-users on reporting tools and best practices.
Proactively identify opportunities for data analysis to boost operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Stay current with data analysis tools and methodologies, continuously improving our insights.


Skills & Experience

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications:


5+ years of experience providing business-critical insights through data analysis.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience with Power BI or SSAS data analysis tools.
Direct experience with on-premises data environments (SSIS/SSAS) is highly valued.
Experience in data management within a large international company. Experience working in the maritime, defense, or manufacturing industry is considered a plus.
Excellent references, as a security screening is part of the hiring process.
Permanent EU citizenship and passport are both required. Candidates with EU (work) visa or with both an EU and non-EU nationality and/or passport are not eligible in accordance with the requirements imposed by the military nature of our projects.


What We Offer

At Damen Naval, we highly value our employees, and we will support your professional and personal development. We also provide our employees with:


A competitive salary and 8% holiday pay.
27 holidays and 13 ADV days.
Travel allowance of 23 cents per kilometre.
PME-pension arrangement with an employer contribution of 60%.
Profit sharing based on company results.
Flexibility to work from home up to two days a week.
Additional benefits including a bicycle plan and company fitness.


Application & information

Are You Interested In This Position, Please Submit Your Application With Your CV And Cover Letter, Along With An Indication Of


Your (preferred) monthly gross salary based on fulltime work.
Availability (fulltime / part-time / number of hours).
Notice period / possible starting date.


For more information about this vacancy or Damen Naval, please visit the Damen Naval website, the Damen Naval Career website or contact the Corporate Recruitment department via +31 118 485 000.

Please note that due to the military nature of our projects, only candidates who have permanent EU nationality can be considered for vacancies at Damen Naval. Unfortunately, we are not allowed to process candidates who (also) have a non-EU passport or nationality.

A pre-employment and security screening and investigation form part of the recruitment process.

Acquisition and introduction of candidates without a formal request is not appreciated and they will not be considered.
