Title: Game Data Analyst - Games
Description:
At Embark Studios, as a Game Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our team of data professionals, focusing specifically on gaming analytics for our first-person shooter game. You will be instrumental in providing insights and support for our game titles, leveraging data to optimize player experience, and providing actionable insights for the game development team. This position presents an exciting opportunity to merge your love for gaming with your expertise in data analytics.

Example Of Responsibilities


Collaborate and work closely with game designers and business stakeholders
Research and develop metrics and performance indicators
Extract, analyze, and communicate insights from gameplay data
Design telemetry logging
Communicate results clearly and concisely to stakeholders from both game and commercial teams



We would love if you have


Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with database querying, preferably using tools such as BigQuery
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights and recommendations
Proficiency in Python scripting for data manipulation and analysis
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience from working in a fast-paced environment where your skills depend on personal independence and agility
Experience with game analytics and a strong interest in first-person shooter games
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Financial/Risk Data Analyst – BSM Expert | Stockholm (Hybrid)

Be the first in Sweden. Help shape the future. Bring your balance sheet wizardry.




We’re on the hunt for a seasoned financial services professional with solid hands-on experience in FIS Balance Sheet Manager (aka FIS Ambit Focus). This is your chance to step into a highly autonomous role in Stockholm and become the local face of a growing international financial tech consultancy that - despite the sector - doesn’t do stiff suits, rigid hierarchies, or soul-sapping meetings.




This isn’t a fix-it firefighting job. We’re already operating well. But we know with the right person on the ground, we could be doing even more - and smarter. You’ll join a team that’s killing it across the Nordics, and you’ll be the first dedicated hire in Sweden. No pressure. But also, lots of opportunity.







🧠 What you’ll be doing:

You'll partner with banking clients to deliver and support BSM solutions - think implementation, technical setups, data pipelines, upgrades, and modelling. You’ll be part business brain, part tech whiz, and (hopefully) part data ninja.




Work on-site with clients and remotely with internal teams.
Tackle ALM and Liquidity modelling like a pro.
Dive into installations, configurations, ETL processes, and module rollouts.
Bonus points if you’ve touched other modules (IFRS9, FTP, Market Risk, etc.).
Contribute to pre-sales discussions and solution discovery.
Play a key role in shaping how we grow in Sweden.




This is a “wear-many-hats” kind of role where you’ll get to influence how things are done - not just do what you’re told.




🧩 We’d love to hear from you if:

You’ve got 3+ Years of hands-on experience with BSM, especially in ALM and Liquidity.
You know your way around SQL and ETL like it’s second nature.
You’ve worked on installations, upgrades, and know how to troubleshoot when things get weird.
You understand a bank’s balance sheet like a chef knows their knives.
You’re a self-starter, but not a lone wolf - you can build trust with clients and work solo or in teams.
You’re fluent in both Swedish and English.
You’re based in (or ready to move to) Stockholm.




You don’t have to tick every box. Maybe you lean more technical, or more on the modelling and reporting side - we’d still love to chat.




🎯 Why this role is special:

You’re first. Be the pioneer in Sweden. Shape the local culture. Influence who gets hired next.
No red tape. Flat hierarchy. Here, titles don’t create distance. Whether you're a newbie or a vet, everyone's voice gets heard - even by the CEO
Community vibes. Over 200 professionals strong, but with a start-up soul. Slack channels for esports, discord community for after work hours, social events in the headquarters.
Growth trajectory. We’ve grown 15-30% year on year. All organic. Zero debt. We’re here for the long haul.
Employee-owned. After 3 years, you can become a shareholder. Yup, we put our money where our culture is.
Flex life. Hybrid working, strong trust culture, low politics. You do your best work, your way.




🌍 A bit about us (anonymously, for now):

We’re a Nordic powerhouse in the world of balance sheet management and risk analytics. While our home base is in Finland, we’ve already got boots on the ground in Sweden - and now we’re ready to give those boots a full-time owner. Our clients are household names in banking, and we’re proud to be long-term partners, not short-term vendors.




If you’re into finance but allergic to dull, love complex puzzles but not endless bureaucracy, and want to be part of something that’s growing fast but staying human - we’d love to hear from you.




Ready to have a real say in how things grow? Apply now. Let’s talk.

Show more

Ready to have a real say in how things grow? Apply now. Let’s talk.

Title: Attribution Analyst - Measurement & Analytics, Marketing
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an Attribution Analyst to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This is a heavily analytical role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, media, and business impact. You’ll be responsible for conducting advanced attribution analyses that inform media investment decisions across the globe and drive marketing effectiveness across channels.

What You’ll Do  

As an Attribution Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your key responsibilities will include:


Conduct attribution analysis using methods such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) and Regression-Based Attribution (RBA) to evaluate media channel effectiveness.
Support the development and evolution of our measurement framework to ensure it meets business needs and strategic requirements.
Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy across attribution models.
Generate actionable insights on media performance and recommend budget reallocations and strategy adjustments to improve ROI and support business growth.
Build and present reports and dashboards that clearly communicate attribution findings to stakeholders across marketing and media teams.
Work closely with the Attribution Lead to align on methodology, priorities, and roadmap.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including media, CRM, strategy, and finance to embed attribution insights into planning and execution.
Partner with our regional marketing teams to support local implementation of attribution insights and ensure global consistency.
Contribute to a test-and-learn culture by continuously monitoring campaign performance and refining attribution approaches.



Qualifications

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

In this role, you’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Marketing function and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams within the marketing unit—including media operations, CRM, strategy and planning, controlling, and technical product teams—as well as our regional marketing teams and the Attribution Lead to ensure that attribution insights are embedded in decision-making and drive measurable business impact.

Who You Are  


At least 3-5 years of experience with digital advertising, large marketing-related organizations, or measurement suppliers
Experience with advertising agencies or complex marketing data-driven organizations preferred
Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling
Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Knowledge of digital media platforms & attribution such as Google Ads, meta ads, TikTok
Familiarity with privacy-first innovation for measurement systems
Strong business acumen with the ability to connect attribution insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and supporting marketing or media planning functions.
A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for data-driven marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.



Additional Information

WHO WE ARE

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.  

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).  
H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.  



JOIN US  

This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.  

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

 *We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

As an Attribution Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Conduct attribution analysis using methods such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) and Regression-Based Attribution (RBA) to evaluate media channel effectiveness.
  • Support the development and evolution of our measurement framework to ensure it meets business needs and strategic requirements.
  • Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy across attribution models.
  • Generate actionable insights on media performance and recommend budget reallocations and strategy adjustments to improve ROI and support business growth.
  • Build and present reports and dashboards that clearly communicate attribution findings to stakeholders across marketing and media teams.
  • Work closely with the Attribution Lead to align on methodology, priorities, and roadmap.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including media, CRM, strategy, and finance to embed attribution insights into planning and execution.
  • Partner with our regional marketing teams to support local implementation of attribution insights and ensure global consistency.
  • Contribute to a test-and-learn culture by continuously monitoring campaign performance and refining attribution approaches.


Qualifications

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

In this role, you’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Marketing function and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams within the marketing unit—including media operations, CRM, strategy and planning, controlling, and technical product teams—as well as our regional marketing teams and the Attribution Lead to ensure that attribution insights are embedded in decision-making and drive measurable business impact.

Who You Are  

  • At least 3-5 years of experience with digital advertising, large marketing-related organizations, or measurement suppliers
  • Experience with advertising agencies or complex marketing data-driven organizations preferred
  • Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling
  • Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
  • Knowledge of digital media platforms & attribution such as Google Ads, meta ads, TikTok
  • Familiarity with privacy-first innovation for measurement systems
  • Strong business acumen with the ability to connect attribution insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams and supporting marketing or media planning functions.
  • A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for data-driven marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.


Additional Information

WHO WE ARE

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.  

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

  • 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).  
  • H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.  


JOIN US  

This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.  

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

 *We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst, App and Content Team

Nine years after the launch, BookBeat has grown to more than 1 million paying users - and this is just the beginning of our journey! To continue delivering the best user experience and staying at the forefront of understanding and serving our users’ needs, we’re expanding our team with a talented Senior Data Analyst.




Are you looking for an opportunity to work with a skilled team in a dynamic, fast-paced organisation? Do you thrive on using data to shape product development, enhance user experiences, and drive business growth? Then we might have the job for you!




About the Team

A BookBeat-user on average spends an incredible 24 hours per month in our app. Two key factors of the success are that the app experience is user-friendly and that books provided to the users are relevant and inspiring. To maintain and elevate this, our team works with data driven projects and provides actionable insights that guide both our app and content teams.




As part of our data analytics and science team, you’ll have a central role of our mission. Your work will directly support the development of the app and its content, ensuring that we continue to provide users with a world-class listening and reading experience.




Your Role

In your day to day work you’ll be working with a variety of tasks that all aim at understanding our users, make data driven decisions and help in making the app and its content as great as possible.




Leveraging large-scale user data to define business questions and generate insights
Based on insights, propose and communicate actionable improvements to the organization
Creating and sharing clear reports and visualizations to track and understand user behavior




You’ll have the possibility to work with tasks such as design and analyzing A/B tests to optimize new app features and build models to help our users discover their next favorite book.




You will work closely with the app and content team and will be a part of the entire lifecycle of a project, from coming up with new ideas, defining business questions and analyzing data, to presenting insights and driving actions. Strong communication skills are essential, as you’ll play a key role in fostering a data-driven culture across the organization.




We’re looking for someone that:

has at least 3 years experience working in a similar role
has an education within a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, economy or similar
take ownership of their work, proactively drive initiatives and enjoy seeing projects through from start to finish
has a strong analytical mindset and genuine interest in understanding our users and enjoy transforming data to actionable insights
likes inventing new and helpful ways of visualizing data and might have experience within tools such as Power BI or similar
likes working cross functionally in a fast-moving organization
is skilled in SQL
communicates fluently in Swedish and English in both writing and speaking. Other language skills (e.g. German, Finnish, Polish, French, Dutch or Danish) are a bonus!
Having experience working with user-oriented questions in previous roles is a big plus!




If this sounds like you please submit your application today! We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and may fill the position quickly. If you have any questions, please contact Stefanie Möllberg, stefanie.mollberg@bookbeat.com.




As an employee of BookBeat AB, you can enjoy a benefit package that includes the following:

🌴 30 days of vacation each year

💰 ITP1 occupational pension

💌 Occupational group life insurance, work injury insurance & business travel insurance

🎾 Yearly wellness allowance

🤸 ♂️ Weekly wellness hour

💻 Working equipment (computer and phone) as well as phone subscription

🎧 BookBeat subscription




In addition to our benefits, we’ll also provide you with:

💜 A stable and sustainable work-life balance. We use flex time and work 37,9 hours a week

🏢 An office located in the heart of Stockholm

🏃 ♀️ … including access to a full gym complete with a sauna! We also arrange other fun wellness activities, such as our own running club

🚀 The opportunity to grow in your role and career, including challenging & educational work tasks as well as opportunities for education

✨ Fun activities together with colleagues! At BookBeat you’ll enjoy weekly Friday afternoon mingles, monthly company breakfasts and other work events such as Holiday & summer parties, and frequent company wide events

🧪 The opportunity to explore projects that you might not have time to do in your day-to-day work during Hack Days

🧠 Knowledge sharing opportunities, e.g. during our weekly Friday demo where different teams share what they’ve been or will be working on. Knowledge sharing is also an integral part of our everyday work

🤛 (Last but definitely not least) A wonderful and skilled team and manager that will support you throughout your employment!




About us

In 2015, we began our journey towards the goal of offering Europe’s leading service for digital books and in 2016, we launched to the public. Now, about 9 years since our broad launch, BookBeat is used by over 1 million users every month. We are an ever-growing company within the Bonnier Group and all members who join our journey have the possibility to make an impact on our development – both in the short and long run.




Today, Team BookBeat consists of 170 curious and committed doers. Are you interested in becoming part of our team? Wonderful! While our employees are experts at many different areas, we have four core values uniting all of us:




🚀 Be great at what you do

📣 Share what you know

🔎 Curiosity for our users and us

🤝 Build Team BookBeat




In other words: we want our employees to continuously deep dive into and develop within their area(s) of expertise, but also to share that knowledge with their colleagues – we’re all in this together and cooperate (most often a lot) on a daily basis! We’re also looking for employees who are genuinely curious about our users, journey and organization, a curiosity that drives us to always test out new things in our service and to let our users show us if we’re on the right track. Last but definitely not least we want all our employees to contribute to the everyday cooperations and the wellbeing of Team BookBeat – as already mentioned, we’re in this together and we want our team to be healthy and happy at work, and we all contribute to this in different ways.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.




As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
At least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have:

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Finance Analytics & BI Lead
Description:
We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!

As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.

The Role: Make Your Mark in a Data-Driven Finance Team

We process millions of parking transactions every month—and this number is only growing. Ensuring our financial data flows seamlessly and accurately across systems (from our parking platform to our ERP and BI tools) is essential. That’s where you come in.

You’ll work at the intersection of Finance and Technology—partnering closely with stakeholders, developing scalable ETL pipelines, and delivering trustworthy financial data models and reports.

🧠 Your Mission


Understand finance requirements and translate them into smart, scalable technical solutions.
Own ETL processes for financial data from systems like Snowflake and NetSuite ERP.
Develop, maintain, and optimize financial reports using tools like QlikSense, Looker, SQL, and dbt.
Ensure data consistency and accuracy across systems
Collaborate with cross-functional data and finance teams to drive automation and transformation initiatives.
Support the implementation of a global ERP system, including data migration and reporting.


🔍 Is This You?

You’re detail-driven and analytical, with the technical expertise and financial fluency to identify data inconsistencies and uncover insights. You’re not afraid to challenge the status quo, automate a clunky process, or dive deep into data to find the story.

Your background


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or BI Specialist working closely with Finance teams.
Strong ETL and data pipeline skills, with a solid grasp of data warehousing concepts.
Advanced SQL and experience with BI/reporting tools such as QlikSense, or Looker.
Understanding of financial reporting requirements and ERP data structures.
A degree in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or related field (Master’s in Data/Analytics is a plus).
Bonus if you’ve worked with dbt, Planacy or Python.


🧩 The Team: Financial Systems & Data

You’ll Join a Collaborative Team Dedicated To


Streamlining financial processes through data and automation.
Supporting global finance reporting and compliance needs.
Driving adoption of financial tools that enhance insight and efficiency.
Managing data governance, accuracy, and security.


This role is based in Stockholm Sweden.

About Us

Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.

Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.

We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.

Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.

In this role, you will be joining one of the teams working on our freight management platform for electric transport. The platform includes systems for handling vehicle telematics and backends, systems and interfaces for transport planning, and machine learning models for energy consumption. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble and creative Data Engineer who is passionate about creating simple, beautiful and helpful solutions to empower the transport industry to go electric.

As a Data Engineer at Einride you will build data pipelines using real-time data from vehicles and logistics systems to enable actionable insights around sustainability and performance

You will


Build high quality data pipelines to power dashboards, business reports and machine learning models
Work with external and internal data consumers to understand and predict their needs in terms of datasets
Develop strategy and architecture for collecting, organizing and leveraging data
Foster data engineering craftsmanship and mentor junior data engineers


We Expect You To


Have extensive experience in working hands-on with real-world datasets
Are fluent in modern, cloud-native data engineering tools. We use SQL, BigQuery, dbt, Dagster and Google Pub/Sub among others.
Have experience with some general-purpose programming language such as Python, Java or Go
Are eager to champion data engineering best practices and guide colleagues in their adoption


Ideally You Also Bring


Experience with data engineering and data architecture in Google Cloud Platform
Experience from setting up data flows that provide automated verification and error handling


This position is full-time and based in Stockholm. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
Show more

We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

Title: 2x Data Engineers
Description:
We are looking for 2 experienced Data Engineers that will join the client's Data Processing product area, to help us increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:


Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.


Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Internship (Unpaid)- Start hösten 2025
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datadrivna beslutsstöd?

Till innovativa insurtechbolaget Allina, söker vi nu en nyfiken och teknikintresserad intern som vill bidra till utvecklingen av deras moderna BI-plattform i Microsoft Azure och Power BI. Har du ett brinnande intresse för dataanalys och vill lära dig hur man bygger skalbara och smarta analyslösningar i praktiken? Då är det här internshipet för dig – med start hösten 2025!

Om Allina Försäkringar

Allina är ett svenskt insurtechbolag i stark tillväxt. Vi bygger digitala försäkringslösningar som skapar kundvärde och affärsnytta för våra partners där försäkringen integreras sömlöst i deras befintliga ekosystem.

Vårt team består av branschexperter med djup kunskap inom både försäkring och marknadsföring. Vi stöttar våra partners med den kunskap och expertis de behöver för att lyckas. Vi tror starkt på värdet i att skapa försäkringslösningar under varje företags eget varumärke. Men vi tror också att varje företag har ett ansvar att bidra till en tryggare och mer hållbar framtid för kommande generationer. På Allina samarbetar vi med våra partners för att skapa just det.

🔍 Vad får du göra?

Som BI Intern ansvarar du för att underhålla, förbättra och vidareutveckla vår befintliga business intelligence-plattform. Den används både internt och av våra partners och är en viktig del i vår digitala tjänsteleverans. Ditt arbete kommer bland annat att innebära att:


Underhålla och vidareutveckla vår BI-plattform byggd i Microsoft Azure och Power BI
Skapa och optimera dashboards och rapporter för olika interna och externa användningsområden
Arbeta med datamodellering, integrationer och datakvalitet i Azure-miljö
Bygga nya skalbara strukturer som gör vår plattform framtidssäkrad och enkel att vidareutveckla
Vara en nyckelperson i att skapa datadrivna insikter både för oss och våra partners



Vi söker dig som har


Kunskap och erfarenhet inom Microsoft Azure och Power BI
God förståelse för datamodellering, pipelines och plattformsarkitektur
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och proaktivt inom dataanalys och plattformsutveckling
Erfarenhet av att utveckla skalbara lösningar och förståelse för hur man bygger för tillväxt
En pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom t.ex. datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik eller motsvarande
God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift



Vad vi erbjuder


Ett spännande och tekniskt utvecklande internship i ett snabbväxande insurtechbolag
Möjligheten att bygga BI-lösningar på riktigt – som påverkar både våra interna team och våra externa kunder
Flexibilitet i arbetstid och delvis distansarbete
Ett engagerat och nytänkande team där din kompetens värdesätts
Placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm



Frågor och kontakt

I denna process samarbetar Allina Försäkringar med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.

Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.

  • Ett engagerat och nytänkande team där din kompetens värdesätts
  • Placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm


Frågor och kontakt

I denna process samarbetar Allina Försäkringar med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

#IT

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Att jobba som data engineer

Som data engineer kommer du tillhöra vårt Data & Analytics team som är organiserat inom Finance för att stötta hela Skandias verksamhet. Teamet består av arkitekter, systemutvecklare och verksamhetsutvecklare som alla sitter på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi är med och bidrar till Skandias digitaliseringsresa genom att etablera ett nytt informationsförsörjningssystem och förbättrade analyticsförmågor. Vi säkerställer att rätt data finns tillgänglig på ett effektivt och säkert sätt.

I rollen kommer du bidra till att vi på Skandia ska bli ännu mer datadrivna i våra analyser och beslut där uppdraget spänner sig från kravanalys till färdiga insikter.

Några Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter Är


Kravarbete – förstå affärsutmaningar och omvandla dem till datadrivna lösningar för analys och rapportering.
Datamodellering & visualisering – analysera, modellera och visualisera data från flera källor och domäner i Tableau och Power BI.
Avancerad analys – utnyttja Python/R, Machine Learning och Advanced Analytics för att skapa prediktiva och preskriptiva insikter.
Kommunikation – presentera resultat pedagogiskt för både teknik- och affärssidan.


Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till chefen för Data & Analytics.

För att lyckas i rollen

Som person är du strukturerad, analytisk och kan kommunicera med andra intressenter både internt och externt. Du har ett teknikintresse och stöttar andra medarbetare i ditt vardagliga arbete.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har några års erfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Analyst, BI-specialist eller motsvarande. Du har en vana att hantera stora och komplexa datamängder både “on-prem” och i moln-miljöer, gärna Azure eller Snowflake. Vidare har du kunskap i SQL samt erfarenhet av ETL-verktyg. Du har även kunskap i Python och/eller R för databearbetning och analys. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du kan svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.

Meriterande är om du har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller har jobbat inom bank-, finans- eller försäkringsområdet sedan tidigare.

Vad händer nu?

Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.

Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Hellen Malmberg på hellen.malmberg@skandia.se.

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquistion Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.

Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Mer om Finance

Inom Finance arbetar vi framåt tillsammans för att vara en affärsnära partner och skapa långsiktigt värde för Skandia. Totalt sett består vi av fem olika avdelningar med ungefär 120 medarbetare som alla sitter i Stockholm på Lindhagensgatan 86.

Våra avdelningar inom Finance är: Finance Transformation & Infomation , Accounting & Reporting, Aktuarie & Modellering, Inköp & Support samt Group Planning & Control.

Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa ett effektivt och värdeskapande Finance. Vi arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa effektiva kärnprocesser genom att följa externa och interna krav. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.


Show more

Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.

Title: Research Associate - Data Analytics and Decision Making
Description:
This Job is based in Australia

Research Associate - Data Analytics and Decision Making

Employment type: Full-time (35 hours per week)

Duration: Fixed term contract, 12 months

Remuneration: Level A, Step 6 from $113,911 plus 17% super

Location: Canberra, ACT OR Sydney, NSW

About UNSW Canberra

University of New South Wales (UNSW) in Canberra has multiple locations in the Nation’s Capital.

UNSW Canberra distinguishes itself from other institutions by its commitment to being thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all endeavours. This combined approach is integral to the University's impact and contributes to its recognition as one of the top 50 universities globally, as well as a proud member of Australia's esteemed Group of Eight. Choosing a career at UNSW means embracing an environment where thriving, facing challenges, and engaging in meaningful work are not just encouraged but integral to the university experience. If you seek a career where you can excel and contribute meaningfully, you've found the right place.

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

The Defence Trailblazer for Concept to Sovereign Capability is a $250 million enterprise powered by UNSW and UoA, with funding from the Australian Government through the Trailblazer Universities Program, as well as university and industry partners. Our mission is to accelerate the commercialisation of research for the Australian Defence Force (ADF), develop education training pathways, fast-track entrepreneurs' ideas to commercialisation, and enhance collaboration between Industry, government, and academia.

Why Your Role Matters

You will join a high-performing interdisciplinary research group, the Decision Support & Analytics Research Group (DSARG), with clear aims to bring innovations at the interface of artificial intelligence and production scheduling and predictive maintenance. You will work with the School of Systems & Computing, a hub of experts on AI, Cyber and Systems Engineers. The

About The Project And The Role

Ocius Technology and UNSW Canberra are partnered on a project to increase the rapid scaling of production of Uncrewed Surface Vessels (USVs). Supported by funding from Defence Trailblazer, the project is developing an integrated production and maintenance facility, along with an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-powered logistics support framework, led by Dr. Ripon K. Chakrabortty, Founder & Leader of DSARG, School of Systems & Computing, UNSW Canberra.

The Ocius Bluebottle USV fleet is powered by renewable energy, utilizing solar, wind, and wave power, or a combination of energy sources, and offers economic and operational advantages over conventional methods. Ocius is a key supplier to the Royal Australian Navy (RAN), and this collaborative project will directly support Australia’s security by scaling production and supporting a capable and resilient sovereign supply chain.

Under the direction of the project’s UNSW lead, the Research Associate will be involved in conducting the technical tasks of the project, primarily related to flexible workspace layout design and AI-based predictive maintenance models.

Who You Are

Our ideal candidate will have


A PhD in Data Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science or similar discipline in addition to demonstrated strong performance in research in the areas of Production and Layout Design, Facility Planning, AI-based tools for Predictive and Preventive Maintenance.
Demonstrated ability to undertake high-quality academic research and conduct independent research, preferably in AI and supporting areas.
Software skills, involvement in the profession and/or Industry, and experience working with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) systems would be considered added benefits.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team, collaborate across disciplines and build effective relationships.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills appropriate for interacting effectively with team members, collaborators and colleagues across the Faculty.
A demonstrated ability to complete tasks within agreed time frames with suitable supervision.



Benefits And Culture

UNSW is committed to helping staff balance work-life responsibilities, by providing access to high-quality services, facilities, and flexible work and leave arrangements.


Generous superannuation contributions
Employee discounts
A commitment to life long learning
UNSW-wide strategy to focus on Healthy Body, Healthy Mind, Healthy Places and Healthy Culture.



Eligibility

The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.

Candidates must hold Australian citizenship to be considered for this position. The successful candidates must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Baseline Security Clearance (i.e. Australian Citizen). Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

How To Apply

Make each day matter with a meaningful career at UNSW. Please apply via our online recruitment system.

In Your Application, Please Include


your CV
a 2-page cover letter addressing the skills and experience outlined in the Position Description.



Applications Close: Wednesday 13 August 2025 at 11:55 pm

Contact:

For role-related queries please contact:

Dr Ripon K. Chakrabortty

r.chakrabortty@unsw.edu.au

For Recruitment Process Related Queries Please Contact

Holly Whale – Talent Acquisition Consultant

h.whale@unsw.edu.au

Applications cannot be accepted if sent directly to the contact listed.

Find out more about the lifestyle and benefits when working with UNSW

For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit: UNSW Canberra

For further information on living in Canberra, please visit: Living in Canberra

UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Stockholm and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Swedish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a Data Engineer to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.




Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.




About the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer that will join the client's Data Processing product area, in LilEngine squad, to help the team increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.




What you'll do

Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.




Who you are

You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.




We are Market Partner

Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.

Title: Nätanalytiker
Description:
Är du redo för att hänga med på vår spännande resa? Ellevio är ett av Sveriges största energibolag och tillsammans fortsätter vi att elektrifiera Sverige. Hos oss är du en del av en trygg och viktig framtidsbransch samtidigt som du får möjlighet att göra skillnad, växa som individ och ha riktigt kul på vägen! Vi tror på en ljus och hållbar framtid, gör du?

Om rollen som Nätanalytiker

För att möjliggöra energiomställningen och möta framtidens behov av el krävs en djupare förståelse för elnätets kapacitet och flexibilitet. I rollen som Nätanalytiker kommer du att spela en central roll i att analysera och prognostisera hur elnätet påverkas av förändrade laster och nya produktionskällor, såsom sol- och vindkraft. Du kommer att arbeta med att identifiera flaskhalsar, analysera och visualisera kapacitetsbehov och utvärdera flexibilitetslösningar – både tekniskt och ekonomiskt.

En viktig del av arbetet är att visualisera och kommunicera dessa insikter till olika delar av organisationen, för att stödja beslut kring investeringar, drift och underhåll. Teamet består av totalt elva personer och vi är ett ambitiöst men hjälpsamt gäng som brinner för att leverera värde till verksamheten. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med verksamhetsutvecklare, data engineers och andra tekniska experter för att skapa en helhetsbild av elnätets utveckling. Du kan även komma att ha kontakt med motsvarande funktioner hos andra nätägare.

Till din hjälp har du en modern analysplattform samt analysverktyg som Power BI, SQL och Python, men i denna roll ligger fokus också på systemanalys, förståelse för elnätets dynamik och strategisk planering.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har en ingenjörsutbildning, gärna inom energisystem eller elkraft – alternativt annan högre utbildning med data- eller analysinriktning, kombinerad med erfarenhet av elnätsverksamhet.

Det viktigaste är att du har en stark analytisk förmåga och ett intresse för elnätets roll i energiomställningen. Du har erfarenhet av kapacitetsanalyser, datadrivna analyser eller arbete som gett dig en helhetsförståelse för elnätets drift, planering och förvaltning.

Du har en holistisk syn på elnätet och förstår hur olika delar hänger ihop – från produktion och konsumtion till styrning, investering och underhåll. Du deltar gärna, eller leder, utvecklingsprojekt och är van att kommunicera komplexa analyser på ett pedagogiskt sätt.

Du trivs i en roll med stor frihet att forma ditt arbete, men där mål och prioriteringar kan skifta över tid. För rollen krävs att du har god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

Ellevio som arbetsgivare

Det är viktigt för oss att medarbetare trivs, känner engagemang och drivs av viljan att kontinuerligt lära nytt och utvecklas. Endast då kan vi tillsammans nå vår vision om en ljus och hållbar framtid. Hos oss får du stora möjligheter att både påverka företaget i stort och din egen karriär. Ett fint bevis på det är att vi i år blivit utnämnda till Karriärföretag för femte året i rad!

Vi arbetar ständigt för ett hållbart och utvecklande arbetsklimat där jämställdhet, mångfald och inkludering är en självklarhet. Till exempel finns ELLE-nätet, Ellevios interna kvinnliga nätverk, för att skapa förutsättningar för ökad samverkan och trivsel.

Om du vill ta reda på mer:


Vem gör vad när Ellevio elektrifierar Sverige?
Möt några av dina blivande kollegor
Läs mer om vårt erbjudande till anställda
Läs mer om vår rekryteringsprocess


Bra för dig att veta!

Vi vill tillsätta våra tjänster så snart vi hittar en bra match och därför rekommenderar vi dig att inte vänta med att skicka in din ansökan. Gillar du det du har läst hittills och vill vara med på vår resa framåt – skicka in ditt CV eller Linkedinprofil senast den 29 augusti.

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Henrik Rinnemo på henrik.rinnemo@ellevio.se. Vid frågor gällande ansökningsprocessen kontakta rekryteringsansvarig Gabriella Boumadi på gabriella.boumadi@ellevio.se.

Under vecka 30-32 är vi på semester så svar kan dröja. På grund av semesterperiod kommer vi att påbörja urval och återkoppling tidigast från vecka 33 och 34. Tack för ditt tålamod – vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan!

Då vi är en samhällsviktig verksamhet genomför vi alltid bakgrundskontroller på samtliga slutkandidater. Om den aktuella tjänsten är inplacerad i säkerhetsklass genomför vi, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585,) en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll innan anställning. Om du söker en tjänst hos oss som kan komma att krigsplaceras får du information om det i samband med din anställning.

Ansök

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a driven and skilled Data Scientist to design, deploy, and optimize ML models that drive automation and impact key areas like credit risk and fraud detection. Join us to shape the future of ML at Froda!

About Froda

Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission – to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy and affordable for business owners to invest in their ideas. Our objective approach champions diversity, ensures fair terms, and ultimately enables more small businesses to make a positive impact on society.

Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.

Your Impact

Design, build, and deploy machine learning models to drive automation and efficiency across areas like credit risk, fraud detection, AML, customer service, and business analytics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, robust solutions that support Froda’s strategic goals of scalability, standardization, and reliability.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with product, engineering, and analytics teams to deliver scalable and impactful AI and ML solutions.
Design, build, and deploy ML models and pipelines for critical business areas.
Implement and optimize ML-Ops workflows (data processing, model training, deployment, and monitoring).


What You'll Bring


Experience of working as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer in tech, fintech, or a similar product-driven company.
Hands-on experience with production ML pipelines, ML-Ops frameworks, and cloud platforms (e.g., KubeFlow, Azure).
Proven skills in Python, SQL, and ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT APIs, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG).
Knowledge of credit risk, fraud detection, or AML is a clear plus.


Who You Are


Results-driven problem solver with a passion for impact through data and AI and that thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Collaborative team player, contributing to innovation and knowledge-sharing in the team and across the business.
Strong communicator, able to break down complex ideas into clear insights.


What’s in it for you?

Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds – fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.

Furthermore, you’ll get:


Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
Competitive compensation package
Insurance and pension plan


Be part of a growing team where your work directly impacts the company’s success. Join us in driving meaningful change through AI and machine learning.

Please note that due to summer vacations, our response time may be delayed.
Show more

Please note that due to summer vacations, our response time may be delayed.

Title: Market Insights Analyst at TRATON Charging Solutions
Description:
TRATON Charging Solutions is on a mission to accelerate the electrification of commercial transport across Europe. To strengthen our data insights capabilities, we are now seeking a Market Insights Analyst for the Operations and Data-team.

This role is ideal for someone who likes to work with data and analytics in a fast-paced environment with many different stakeholders. It involves frequent international collaboration and offers a dynamic work environment with a diverse range of tasks that value a can-do-attitude, effective relationship management, and adaptability. As our Market Insights Analyst you will work with gathering, analyzing and presenting data and insights from the BEV industry and the HDV market more specifically.

Your Responsibilities



Perform various market and competitor analysis regarding price, features and coverage of other similar services and potential partners.
Set up, maintain, analyze and communicate purchase prices of electricity.
Maintain and expand the activation and classification of our charging network. Gather input and data regarding the charging network, both existing and planned. Perform strategic analysis on where to expand and focus our efforts.
Share insights and lead discussions regarding findings of the analyzes made.
Common operational maintenance, set-up and support tasks.



Your Profile



Analytical: Experience from previous analytical roles with proven great results.
Thrives in a learning environment: Demonstrates an interest in both technical and holistic understanding, continuously expanding their knowledge base.
Is supportive and collaborative: Possesses a natural inclination to support and teach others, contributing to a collaborative work environment.
University Degree: A solid educational foundation is essential. Business or engineering background is preferred, but not mandatory.
Language skills: Excellent communication skills in English.



Why Join Us?



Help shape the future of electric commercial vehicle charging across one of Europe’s most critical regions
Play a key role in scaling a high-impact initiative within the TRATON GROUP, home to Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International
Work in a dynamic role with touch points with many different stakeholders and roles



Apply Now!

TRATON offers this vacancy in Stockholm, starting at the earliest possible date. If you’re ready to take on this exciting challenge and contribute to the transformation of commercial vehicle charging, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today by sending your CV and cover letter to contact email. If you have any questions, please contact lovisa.bergstroem@traton.com. Please apply latest by 10 August.

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Employment type: Full-time

TRATON SE

Hanauer Straße 26 / 80992 Munich / Germany

www.traton.com TRATON Charging Solutions AB

With its brands Scania, MAN, International, and Volkswagen Truck & Bus, TRATON SE is the parent and holding company of the TRATON GROUP and one of the world’s leading commercial vehicle manufacturers. The Group’s product portfolio comprises trucks, buses, and light-duty commercial vehicles. “Transforming Transportation Together. For a sustainable world.”: this intention underlines the Company’s ambition to have a lasting and sustainable impact on the commercial vehicle business and on the Group’s commercial growth.

TRATON Charging Solutions AB

Vagnmakarvägen 1 / 15132 Södertälje / Sweden

www.tratoncs.com

TRATON Charging Solutions, established in 2023 as a part of the TRATON GROUP, is dedicated to providing seamless, reliable charging services for commercial vehicles. As an eMSP, it operates the largest charging network in Europe and powers services such as Scania Charging Access and MAN Charge&Go. With structural readiness in 20 European countries and a mission to cover the entire EU by the end of 2025, TRATON Charging Solutions is at the forefront of accelerating sustainable transport through strategic partnerships and innovative solutions.
Show more

Title: Vill du bygga dataplattformar och utvecklas inom data och analys?
Description:
Vi söker dig som vill växa i en roll där du får arbeta med modern teknik, engagerade kollegor och spännande dataprojekt. Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI) och bidra med din kompetens i arbetet med att bygga vår nya analysplattform för att möjliggöra morgondagens datadrivna analys! Vi är ett engagerat datateam som arbetar agilt för att leverera tjänster till FI:s medarbetare, allmänheten och företag under vår tillsyn. Nu förstärker vi vår dataorganisation. Om jobbet Som data engineer på avdelningen Data- och analysplattformar deltar du i arbetet med att bygga och förvalta plattformar för datadriven analys. Tillsammans med kollegor från både datahanteringen och verksamheten utvecklar du dataflöden, datastrukturer och verktyg som möjliggör smartare beslut och bättre insikter. Du deltar i arbetet med att bygga upp vår nya analysplattform, där du får lära dig mer om områden som datakataloger, data lineage, testramverk, dataprofilering och referensdatahantering. Du arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och delar våra värderingar där vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Du är driven och tycker om att ta egna initiativ och tycker det är kul att programmera. Vi söker dig som


har grundläggande kunskaper och erfarenheter inom data pipelines, ETL/ELT-processer, eller automatisering
har erfarenhet av att programmera i Python och SQL
har erfarenhet av moderna analysplattformar, och komponenter såsom datasjöar och databaser
har grundläggande förståelse om data governance och referensdata
har relevant utbildning inom ett tekniskt ämnesområde
uttrycker dig väl på svenska i både tal och skrift. Det är meriterande om du
har arbetat med Docker/Kubernetes eller andra containerlösningar
har arbetat med kodbaserade API-anrop
har arbetat med BI-verktyg eller datavisualisering
har erfarenhet från offentlig eller finansiell sektor. Om dig


I det här jobbet behöver du


bidra till ett gott samarbete
ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
ta egna initiativ
se framåt och planera ditt arbete utifrån långsiktiga mål. Om FI FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden. På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/ Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på 5 avdelningar och en stab. Bra att veta Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Arbetspsykologiska tester kan ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/arbeta-pa-fi/vi-erbjuder/https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/arbeta-pa-fi/vi-erbjuder/ En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Sök jobbet Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis. Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering. Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Omfattning: Heltid Kontaktperson: Maria Strand Enkullen, avdelningschef, 08-408 987 88 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-08
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform, bringing the joy of savings and investments to our customers. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable everyone to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.

We believe that data is a cornerstone for our future success, and we're building the next generation of banking on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with our analytics platform having moved to GCP in 2020.

Now we're looking for a passionate Analytics Engineer to be the bridge between business and data technology. At Nordnet, we strive to be data pioneers, devoted to harnessing the potential of data and AI. If you want to transform raw information into clear, meaningful data products that impact how we grow, innovate, and enhance our services, this could be your perfect fit.

We would love it if you feel excited about at least some of these statements:


Designing and building elegant data structures in BigQuery.
Ensuring data is accurate and reliable.
Empowering others by making data models and dashboards accessible and understandable for everyone.
Collaborating with diverse teams, bringing their data needs to life through your expertise.


This is you

You're passionate about data and learning new things, and you are a problem solver who wants to contribute with your experience and ideas. In your work, you are organised, methodical and agile in a way that benefits the team environment and ability to deliver solutions.

To thrive in this role, we believe that most of these criteria describe you:


Have several years of experience as an Analytics Engineer/Business Intelligence Developer/Data Engineer.
Skilled in designing and building data warehouses and analytics platforms
Apply software engineering best practices like code reviews to ensure our work is of high quality.
A clear communicator who can simplify complex concepts with ease.
Exhibit deep SQL knowledge and experience with dbt.
Looker (or similar) knowledge for creating inspiring dashboards.


What We Offer

You would be a part of the Data & Insights department, consisting of smart and skilled Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts. Here, you'll not only learn and grow but also contribute with your unique perspective to our success.

We provide our team with a modern tech stack and actively explore the future of data, experimenting with AI to improve how we consume and create data products. You will enjoy the flexibility of hybrid working and a competitive salary and compensation package.

At Nordnet, data is a fundamental part of how we make decisions and innovate. If you're eager to make a difference and work with exciting technology in a supportive and empowering environment, we warmly encourage you to apply!

You are welcome to apply today, but the interviews will start in August.

Application

If you have questions, please contact Alva Hellberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at alva.hellberg@nordnet.se.

Apply today– we will start interviewing in late August after summer vacations. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.

We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.

We look forward to receiving your application!
Show more
