Title: Data Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Step into the exciting world of data and transform the way business is done! Three dynamic teams are seeking a Data Analyst each, where analytical expertise will create transparency through data and support the efficiency and productivity focus across the Global Workplace Projects, Packing, and Processing sites!

In these roles, complex analyses of business functions and processes will be conducted, uncovering insights that propel the company to new heights. A solid understanding of database designs will be crucial in navigating the complex landscape of data, ensuring that applications are supported by robust structures. In these roles you will focus on data for either the packing and packaging area, the processing area, or the global workplace projects area and in particular focus on data from our manufacturing lines.


Core Responsibilities





Conduct complex analysis of business functions/processes and associated data to enable higher efficiency and productivity.
Understanding of database designs (logical/physical) that support complex business processes and applications.
Capable of python/coding expertise to effectively navigate across multiple data domains, identify correlations, perform data analysis and generate relevant data sets.
Actively contribute to data analytics principles and best practices in collaboration with Data Office and BI Manufacturing and be an inspiration and sparring partner for colleagues.
Collaborate with project teams, data analysts, product teams and subject matter experts to provide insights from large complex data sets.




Play your part in our team succeeding

Role 1 This role will be part of team Packing & Packaging Digital Transformation and Portfolio Management focusing on driving digitalization and data driven decision making within Packing & Packaging.

Our mission is to deliver high-quality, reliable data and analytics that empower the P&P organization to make global strategic, data-driven decisions. We are committed to continuously support process automation and operational efficiency with a #oneteam approach.

Role 2 The right candidate will step into Planning & Operational Development which enables R&D Processing to effectively manage the supply chain of creating equipment that literally puts smiles on LEGO Minifugure’s faces

As a data analyst, you will be diving into processes with your colleagues in R&D Processing, and especially with colleagues on our global Processing sites, identifying need for data, analyzing said data, building reports and making recommendations based on your excellent storytelling and communication skills.

Role 3 The right candidate will step into Global Workplace Projects, responsible for large-scale construction and major utility projects. The person will work closely with the Industry 4.0 team and the newly established Data Engineering & Analytics team, supporting Manufacturing in becoming even more data-driven.

Do You Have What It Takes





Proven passion for data as well demonstrable data analytics experience using Python, SQL, or similar. Beneficial to have experience with Databricks
A couple of years of experience with data analysis and/or data experience in Manufacturing.
Experience working as part of an autonomous team, managing personal goals, and contributing to team direction.
Collaborative person by nature and want to be a part of a global cross functional team.
Curious and passionate about building value-creation and innovative solutions.
Beneficial to already be working in/with established network and forums and by that have easy access to knowledge and sparring.
Proficient in English, both written and verbal




The position is based in Billund, DK and relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst PLG (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
⭐️ With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
🍾 We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
🌱 We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we’re building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability — backed by one of the world’s most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that’s already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we’re looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel — from acquisition through expansion.

🎯 Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here’s how you’ll make an impact:

🔍 Become the expert on our PLG funnel


Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.


🧪 Power experimentation and growth


Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.


🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable


Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.


🤝 Enable cross-functional success


Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.


Requirements

Must-haves


🧠 Self-serve PLG analytics experience: You have 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies with a strong self-serve motion. You’ve directly analyzed user behavior across the activation, monetization, and retention funnel, and have helped shape the product strategy through PQL models, funnel mapping, and in-product experimentation.
📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).


Nice-to-haves


👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.


Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness 🩺 –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
Future planning 💰 –
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan.
Financial security 🛡️ –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.
Show more

Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we’re building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability — backed by one of the world’s most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that’s already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we’re looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel — from acquisition through expansion.

🎯 Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here’s how you’ll make an impact:

🔍 Become the expert on our PLG funnel

  • Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
  • Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
  • Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.

🧪 Power experimentation and growth

  • Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
  • Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
  • Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.

🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable

  • Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
  • Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
  • Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.

🤝 Enable cross-functional success

  • Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
  • Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
  • Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.

Requirements

Must-haves

  • 🧠 Self-serve PLG analytics experience: You have 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies with a strong self-serve motion. You’ve directly analyzed user behavior across the activation, monetization, and retention funnel, and have helped shape the product strategy through PQL models, funnel mapping, and in-product experimentation.
  • 📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
  • 🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
  • 🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
  • 🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
  • 📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).

Nice-to-haves

  • 👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
  • 🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
  • 🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
  • 📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.

Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
  • Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
  • Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
    • Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
    • US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
  • Health & wellness 🩺 –
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
  • Future planning 💰 –
    • Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
    • US: 401(k) retirement plan.
  • Financial security 🛡️ –
    • Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
    • US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
  • Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
  • A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
  • Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
  • Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
  • Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
  • An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
  • Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

Title: Data and insights analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

HamiltonAI is a cutting-edge Media & Marketing AI Platform that helps marketers optimize media investments and predict business outcomes with confidence. Our platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to support strategic media planning across all offline and online channels.

Come and join our Customer Success team as a Data & Insights Analyst where you will provide media and business insights to our customers, using our models and other marketing data.

Our Customer Success team is at the heart of turning advanced analytics into real business value. We partner closely with clients to ensure a smooth onboarding experience, seamless implementation of our AI-driven models, and ongoing strategic and operational support.

The team bridges the gap between technology and business, working alongside our Product Delivery, AI, and Data teams. As trusted advisors, we help clients interpret model outputs, uncover insights, and drive better media and marketing decisions. Our goal is simple: empower clients to succeed using our platform.

What You'll Do

As a member of our growing Customer Success team, this is what you will typically spend most of your time on:


Demonstrate a high sensitivity to the structure, quality, and meaning of media, marketing, and business data. You’ll process large datasets efficiently, detect patterns quickly, and extract insights that are accurate, actionable, and aligned with the customer’s business context.
Leverage outputs from our Bayesian Marketing Mix Models (MMM) and other analytical tools to deliver strategic recommendations for media optimization.
Conduct deep-dive analyses and ad hoc explorations using client data, and communicate findings through clear, tailored presentations that resonate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including modeling, product, AI, and data experts—to ensure seamless onboarding, model implementation, and customer engagement.
Assess and ensure the quality and relevance of customer data throughout the client journey, helping to maximize model reliability and output accuracy.
Serve as a trusted thought partner to clients by connecting data insights to broader marketing and business strategy.
Contribute to the development and enhancement of our analytics frameworks, supporting continuous improvement and innovation within the Customer Success team.


What You Bring

We imagine that you are an ambitious, data savvy person who takes pride in getting the details right, but at the same time is concerned with the overall end outcome. You have some years of experience with MMM and have drive and talent, take responsibility and are eager to learn and grow fast.

Moreover, You Exhibit Some Of The Following Personality Traits


Highly customer oriented mindset
Sharp attention to detail
Good communicator
Logical and critical thinker
Ability to work on several customer projects concurrently
Patient and focused
Learning, sparring, asking questions


Requirements


Advanced data skills with strong proficiency in data processing, manipulation, and analysis using tools such as Python, R, SQL, or BI platforms. You’re comfortable working with large, complex datasets and can quickly extract meaningful, actionable insights.
Proven experience in marketing or media analytics, consulting, or related roles—ideally with direct client-facing responsibilities.
Hands-on expertise with Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) is essential; familiarity Bayesian model or other regression model is a plus.
An advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Business Analytics, Econometrics, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to clearly explain complex data insights to technical and non-technical audiences, including clients.
Highly organized and adaptable, with the ability to manage multiple client projects efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
A collaborative, curious mindset with a sharp attention to detail and strong data sensitivity.


Bonus Competencies


Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including explaining and discussing modeling outputs or other analytics approaches with other team members or customers at all levels
Experience in a SaaS, AI, or technology-driven product company.


Why Join HamiltonAI


Be part of a fast-growing team transforming marketing analytics through AI.
Work in a supportive, multicultural environment that values autonomy and growth.
Gain exposure to global clients and real-world applications of cutting-edge modeling techniques.
Collaborate with experienced professionals across disciplines—AI, data science, product, and strategy.


If you see yourself as a part of our team at Kantar and believe that you can contribute something valuable, apply for the position!

About Us

We are very agile and follow modern software engineering best practices. We believe that technology and creativity are the most powerful tools to disrupt and set the standards of a new era. Most of all, we believe in people. The way that we work is guided by some fundamental values:

Trust

We believe that our colleagues will do their best to perform their tasks and to realize our goals. We believe that our colleagues are trustworthy, hardworking, and honest.

Equal worth

We believe that everyone has the same right to make and influence decisions. This means that we safely trust our colleagues to make the majority of the decisions relevant for the role they are filling in the team.

Transparency

We believe that everyone needs full access to all knowledge in order to have the best possible basis for making decisions. We believe that they may have valuable ideas that we otherwise might miss.

If you see yourself as a part of our team and believe that you can contribute with something valuable, apply for the position!

Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions. In this role, you'll bejoining our Data & Analytics team and will be reporting to our Head of Data.






You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices. Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels. Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage expert proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.







Success looks like

Creating exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactively delivering actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Developing and implementing intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Providing insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Communicating complex data insights clearly, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Solving problems proactively and addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Sucessfully exploring and implementing advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven expertise in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Mastery of advanced statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, various regression models, and time series analysis for forecasting.
Solid understanding and practical experience with user activity tracking tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar product analytics platforms.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to establish causal relationships and inform data-driven decision-making.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation
On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan
Growth and progression opportunities – we want you to grow with us
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.






All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more
HTML:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.



At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.



Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.



As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.

You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.

Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.

Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.



This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.



What you'll do

    • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
    • Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
    • Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
    • Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
    • Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
    • Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
    • During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.



Success looks like

    • Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
    • Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
    • Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
    • Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
    • Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
    • Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
    • Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.



What you'll bring with you

    • Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
    • Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Analyst with a sharp investigative mindset and a passion for ethical business practices to join our growing team.

This role can be based in Berlin or Copenhagen, or can be based remotely within Europe.




What You’ll Do:

• Lead or support integrity due diligence, investigations, and business intelligence assignments

• Work closely with our global subcontractor network and freelance researchers

• Scope and develop proposals for new assignments

• Help train and mentor new hires and junior analysts

• Contribute to research innovation, knowledge development, and marketing efforts




What We’re Looking For:

• 1-3 years’ experience in business intelligence, integrity due diligence, or corporate investigations

• Experience in the Nordics (emerging markets experience a plus)

• Full professional English + working proficiency in a Scandinavian language

• University degree in Politics, IR, Security, Social Sciences, Law, or related fields

• Strong analytical, organisational, and communication skills

• A collaborative and independent work ethic - even in remote settings

Title: Student Worker - Data, Analytics & Business Improvement
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about data & analytics, and want to help us build a data-driven culture for digital product development at the LEGO Group?

We are looking for a Student Worker in our Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team. Come and help us build new ways of understanding how our consumers interact with LEGO owned websites and apps, and play a critical part in our ambition to build direct and lasting relationships with millions of LEGO fans around the world.


Core Responsibilities





Support analytics managers in the team with the implementation of user and audience behaviour tracking across our digital touchpoints, ensuring the right mix of known and unknown usage tracking is available in line with the LEGO Group’s policies around the ethical and transparent use of opted-in consumer data.
Build dashboards and self-serve reporting capabilities for different user groups in the company, tailoring reports for the unique data & insight needs of each group (via PowerBI and/or similar data visualisation tools).
Work with a cross-functional data & analytics team to create well structured, easily accessible data sources that can be used for downstream reporting and analysis (via SQL and Pyton, within Databricks).
Build a series of communication assets to explain the different tools, services, and methodologies available from the Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team to understand user behaviour – Build and maintain our internal knowledge repositories, Sharepoint pages, and outbound newsletters / updates to help people across the company keep their finger on the pulse of how our digital product portfolio is performing.
Carry out ad-hoc analysis on digital product performance, user journey analysis, and marketing / content effectiveness, to help our business understand which touchpoints and tactics are driving the greatest value for the business (and why).
Support our team test and learn agenda by continually exploring new methodologies, data sources, and insight partners that will enable us to get a more holistic view of the consumer & shopper.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team is an analytics and continuous improvement practice within the LEGO Group’s Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) function. Our focus is on establishing two-way, long lasting and meaningful relationships with our consumers and shoppers, and we believe that the ethical, transparent, and effective use of consumer data is key to this ambition.

For this role we are seeking an entrepreneurial student worker who wants to bring their passion for data to our team to help us shape the future of how we approach analytics at the LEGO Group. This role will involve a mix of web & app tracking implementation, data engineering, data quality management, and documentation / communication in order to help non-technical stakeholders across the business understand the world of analytics in a simple way. Across these areas, there will be many opportunities to develop hands-on skills across multiple domains of data & analytics.

We are at an exciting stage of our Digital Transformation at the LEGO Group, and this role will help improve our understanding of how consumers behave across our ecosystem of digital touchpoints. You will help make a difference to our digital experience by ensuring that anyone who works on creating experiences for our consumers are grounded in accurate, easy to interpret, and impactful data on how consumers behave and what they want from us. If you are passionate about human behaviour, digital product analytics, and user journey research, this is the role for you.

Do you have what it takes?





It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.
Currently completing a Masters Degree within the fields of Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Data Management, or similar.
Passion for or experience with software development, product management, agile, or digital analytics is an asset.
Enthusiasm for using data to solve complex business problems.
Some understanding of how web tracking tools such as Adobe Analytics and/or Snowplow work, and the how the tracking variables are used to understand user behavior.
Comfort with SQL and PowerBI, and optionally Python (We are comfortable with candidates who need to improve their skills in these areas, as this role is a good opportunity to get hands-on experience).
Familiarity with the principles and practices of data engineering.
A structured quick learner and a natural of curiosity to look for the “so what” behind trends identified in data.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Open, collaborative communication style and comfort creating new ways of doing things in partnership with others.
You are able to work 20 hours a week.
Proficient in writing and speaking English




Nice to have





Hands-on experience turning raw, unstructured data into meaningful insights and recommendations, and comfort using a variety of analytics tools and methodologies – Experience creating meaningful data visualisation and communicating this with non-technical audiences
Experience performing analysis on large data sets in a Big Data platform is an asset (i.e. Databricks or a similar platform)
Experience with applied statistics across multiple data sources
Experience creating data products and working within an Agile development team is an asset
Experience working with Sharepoint and JIRA
Additional language skills a plus but not required




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about driving eCommerce growth through data-driven insights and digital innovation?

If you have a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of digital analytics, and a talent for turning complex data into clear, actionable insights, you might be the perfect fit for our Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights role at Pandora’s Global Office in Copenhagen.

As a Senior Specialist in eCommerce Analytics & Insights, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital performance. You’ll lead the development and implementation of best-in-class website analytics practices, ensuring that data is not only accurate and reliable but also deeply embedded in our commercial decision-making processes.

You will act as the key liaison between Adobe data engineering teams and the broader analytics community, translating business needs into technical solutions and ensuring seamless collaboration across functions. Your insights will directly influence strategic initiatives, helping Pandora deliver exceptional digital experiences and drive measurable business impact.

In this role, you’ll also champion data governance, oversee data quality assurance, and lead the creation of advanced dashboards and visualizations tailored to senior stakeholders. You’ll work closely with regional eCommerce teams and internal partners to anticipate and exceed their analytics needs, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are looking for a highly analytical, commercially minded individual with a strong foundation in digital analytics, stakeholder management, and data storytelling. If you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and are passionate about the power of data to drive growth, we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities:


Define and evolve best-in-class commercial website analytics practices aligned with Pandora’s digital transformation agenda
Act as the primary bridge between Adobe data engineering and commercial analytics teams
Integrate Adobe Analytics insights into core business workstreams to influence strategic decisions
Drive data integrity initiatives across all tracking and reporting mechanisms. Analyse, document and resolve inconsistencies while controlling business impact through stakeholder management. Lead advanced data analysis and visualization efforts, delivering insights through dashboards and reports with multi-system data inputs.
Build strong partnerships with regional eCommerce and internal teams to elevate performance reporting and consolidate strategic data needs into clear technical development requirements.
Promote continuous learning and innovation within the analytics function
Mentor colleagues and elevate the organization’s analytical maturity



Ideally, you have:


4–5 years of experience in website analytics, with at least 4 years owning or managing analytics systems
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Economics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Proven ability to translate complex commercial needs into actionable analytics improvements
Experience with Adobe Analytics (certification is a plus)
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Strong understanding of eCommerce KPIs and the commercial impact of digital analytics



Furthermore, we hope to see that you are:


A strategic thinker with exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation
A clear communicator who can translate data into compelling stories for diverse audiences
Skilled at building trust and partnerships across technical and commercial teams
Proactive, self-motivated, and accountable for delivering results
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint



Your new team

Pandora is a company with a big heart, and we take great pride in treating our people well. You’ll join a passionate, ambitious team within an international, high-impact function.

Additional Information

Global Career Band: 5A

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Business Insights & Report Specialist
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Insight & Reporting Specialist with expertise in Power BI Reporting/Front-end to join our Data & Digitalization team. This role will be instrumental in developing, maintaining, and optimizing reporting solutions that drive business insights, using a combination of tabular models and diverse data sources. The individual will also be a key player in implementing our data strategy. 
 

The role:

This role will focus on designing dynamic performance reports and dashboards, mainly using Power BI, to provide valuable insights for business evaluation and strategic planning. The right candidate will collaborate with senior leadership from all departments and IT teams to ensure data integrity and accessible reporting.

Furthermore, you will:

Design and deliver Power BI reports and dashboards highlighting KPIs on a strategic, tactical and an operational level.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reporting to support the whole business to become more data driven.
Collaborate with teams to align reports with organizational goals.
Develop interactive reports and dashboards integrating data from multiple sources using Power BI.
Ensure reports are accessible and actionable, supporting business users in decision-making.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for reports, models, and data processes.
Implement controls to ensure data quality and manage access protocols.
 


The Team:

The Data & Digitalization team consists of three sub-departments: Applications, Data Strategy & Governance and BI & Architecture. You will be in the BI & Architecture team with four colleagues. All of them are located at the Aarhus office. However, you will be working closely together with Data Strategy & Governance and Applications. You will be working with and reporting for the senior leaders to support strategic decision-making based on Power BI reports.


Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Power BI Front-end development, with a demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and communicate financial and operational performance metrics to support informed decision-making across the business.
 

Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Finance, Data Science, UX Design, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Power BI front-end, financial reporting, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on performance management reporting.
Proven expertise in Power BI, including creating visually compelling, report and dashboards development, data modelling, DAX, and Power Query.
Worked with tabular models and the creating of semantic models.
In-depth knowledge of financial and operational performance metrics and experience reporting on KPIs such as revenue, margins, costs, and profitability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing reporting issues.


What will make you stand out:

Power BI certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
Experience with Microsoft Fabric.
Understanding of SQL for querying data sources and enhancing reporting capabilities.
 


We offer

At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.

We care about our colleague’s work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model

International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams

Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities
 



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.


Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership!


Interested?

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
