Title: ESG & Impact Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.




As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.




This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.




What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.




You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.




You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.




You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.




You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.




What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.




We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?




We think this might look like:

You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.




You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.




You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)




You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.




You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides




In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.




We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Show more
HTML:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.


As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.


This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.


What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.


  • You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.


  • You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.


  • You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.


  • You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.


What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.


We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?


We think this might look like:

  • You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.


  • You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.


  • You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)


  • You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.


  • You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides


In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.


We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Title: Senior Client Insights Analyst
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Opportunity

Are you passionate about turning data into impact, with reports that actually make a difference? At the intersection of neuroscience, AI, and marketing, Neurons partners with some of the world’s leading brands - across industries, agencies, and platforms - offering a unique chance for a talented Insights Analyst to shape how top names make smarter creative and strategic decisions every day.

Your work here won’t just be “reports”; it will shape how clients see, understand, and act on their creative performance. You’ll work across key commercial insight services: from high-level meta-analyses of client testing data to scalable implicit research solutions that enable faster, sharper decisions. You won’t just deliver insights, you’ll bring clarity, confidence, and momentum to every client interaction, making Neurons an indispensable part of their marketing strategy.

And you’ll evolve around our cross-functional core—neuroscientists, PMs, AI engineers, commercial talents, visionaries and innovators, and BI experts—wiring the very neurons that energize every insight, that make Neurons who we are.

Your Impact


Lead high-impact brand strategy: Scale analysis into narrative-driven reports that steer executive creative and marketing decisions.
Drive Explore innovation: Own the design and delivery of streamlined implicit tests that fuel speed, clarity, and commercial growth while championing new methodologies.
Empower commercial teams: Co-present critical insights, advise on strategic positioning, and lead high-value engagements with integrity and long-term partnership in mind.
Define strategic wins: Initiate and steer cross-functional projects where your insight and vision shape enterprise-level solutions.
Be the insight architect: Serve as Neurons’ knowledge authority. Craft advanced frameworks, scale delivery methods, and mentor junior analysts.


Who You Are


You’re an insights-driven thinker and high-impact, proven performer, who transforms complex data into beautiful narratives and impactful decisions, and drives those decisions into sustained momentum.
You thrive in both structure and ambiguity, consistently bringing clarity and strategic direction when others are still figuring out where to begin.
You zoom in and out with exceptional ease - just as confident spotting intricate patterns in data as you are shaping and communicating the overarching strategic narrative.
Curious, compelling, and authoritative, you guide and inspire others with a blend of sharp strategic thinking, clear executive-level direction, and calm confidence.
You’ve built an impressive craft in senior research, analytics, or agency senior roles and you’re ready to make a profound and visible impact across the entire business and with key clients.


About Neurons

Neurons is a SaaS leader in applied neuroscience and AI. Our platform AI predicts consumer responses - attention, emotion, cognition, and memory - with a level of accuracy previously only possible through lengthy testing and post-hoc analysis. By harnessing the latest science and powerful AI models, we enable brands to understand, predict, and influence consumer behavior faster and at a greater scale.

Behind the scenes, our science is continuously supported by our implicit testing solutions that enable our revolution, and our clients to quickly validate creative and campaign direction through scientifically grounded online studies. Together, our tools give customers a powerful mix of speed, scale, and science.

Our Mission: To empower organizations everywhere with evidence-based, predictive insights that drive confident decisions and breakthrough outcomes.

Why Join Us?


Work at the absolute cutting edge. Your insights will shape enterprise-wide creative and go-to-market plans across regions, directly influencing decisions by VPs, executives, and brand stewards at some of the world’s most iconic brands.
Collaborate closely with pioneering neuroscientists, elite AI engineers, and visionary business leaders.
Enjoy a culture of learning, ownership, and impact. Backed by remote flexibility and competitive compensation.
Get access to unparalleled datasets and advanced tools, and help set the public agenda for AI and neuroscience in marketing.


Ready To Make A Difference?

Apply now with a portfolio or sample of your most impactful client insights, strategic reports, or enablement work. Let’s push the boundaries of what’s possible, together.

We are a company that takes pride in the health & well-being of all our employees, with initiatives such as yoga practice, healthy breaks, and mental health resources.

We enjoy coming together for our Friday Hygge, where you might find us singing karaoke, playing bingo, video games or board games.

Other benefits include:


In-house lunch
Pension Plan
Private Health insurance
Parental leave benefits
Quarterly company events
Team Events
Show more

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Intern
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making? Do you want to work on cutting-edge analytics and contribute to shaping the future of forecasting digitalization at Novo Nordisk? If you are ready to be part of innovating, optimizing and creating impactful data solutions, we want you on our team! Read more and apply today.

Your new role

As a Data & Business Intelligence Intern you will:



Contribute to the digitalisation of forecasting processes and outputs, ensuring reliable and state-of-the-art analytics reports for the forecasting function and its customers.
Support in innovating data infrastructure and visualization tools to create a single source of truth for global users.
Contribute to the development and improvement of data pipelines to enable efficient and sustainable data ingestion, processing, modelling, and output serving.
Draft ongoing reports and data visualisations (e.g., dashboards, heat maps) to aid data storytelling for forecasting team.




Your new department

Strategic Forecasting is part of Portfolio Strategy & Access within the Product & Portfolio Strategy. Based in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, the department focuses on analysing market dynamics, identifying trends, and forecasting market development. We provide insightful analysis to senior management, enabling data-driven decision-making in the organization. Join our team and be part of a collaborative and innovative culture where your work will make a real difference.

Your Skills & Qualifications

The candidate should have the following or developing qualifications:



Currently studying for master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or other relevant fields, and will remain a student for the full duration of the internship.
Experience in various business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. Power BI and Fabric).
Knowledge in IT & Analytics cloud architecture.
Knowledge in data management (especially SQL) is a strong plus.
Fluency in both verbal and written English and solid communication skills.




We invite motivated and forward-thinking candidates eager to make a meaningful impact through data-driven insights to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination, and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years, this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect, and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results.

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

More information

You are welcome to contact Director of AI and Advanced Analytics Ani Afyan Semerdjian at aisj@novnordisk.com , if you have questions about the role. Be advised Ani will not support queries about your recruitment status.

Deadline

17 August, 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few lines about your motivation in your resume or CV. In addition, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV. This makes for a better and less biased process.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Search all vacancies
Show more

  • Experience with GDPR compliance
  • Experience with database design and management
  • Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
  • Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
  • Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)

Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:

  • Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
  • Curriculum vitae
  • Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
  • List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
  • Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience

Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: Data & Insights Business Partner
Place: Dragør, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About The Position

As a Data & Insights Business Partner at Sunclass Airlines, you play a key role in shaping our Business Intelligence & data initiatives. As part of the business side of the organization, this role requires a strong focus on data modeling and report design to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders. Your efforts support informed decision-making processes across various departments, ensuring alignment with our strategic goals.

As part of our Data & Analytics team, based in our office in Dragør, your main focus is:


Participate in the development of a business intelligence strategy and roadmap
Work closely with business stakeholders to identify key metrics and data sources
Design and maintain data models and data visualizations
Collaborate with backend developers
Stay abreast of digital technology trends and advancements
Drive data literacy initiatives across Sunclass Airlines


Who We Are Looking For


A genuine interest in working with data to solve business challenges
Experience working with data analysis or data visualization tools (academic, internship, or professional)
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work well in cross-functional teams
An understanding of basic business processes and how data supports decision-making


We’re looking for someone who is proactive, open to learning, and enjoys collaborating with others. If you're passionate about using data to make a difference and want to develop your skills in a supportive and dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you.

We offer

As part of our Data & Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to influence the business and work creatively, shaping the future of our initiatives. We work closely with our colleagues in the Nordic countries to give our guests the best weeks of the year. We also maintain a high level of employee engagement, consistently demonstrated in our internal employee surveys. We love our jobs and welcome you on board our journey with the Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Other Information

Deadline: Please send your application as soon as possible. Applications are evaluated continuously, and interviews will take place as applications come in.

Start date: As soon as possible and after agreement.

For questions about the role, please contact Thomas Blicher, Head of SCA Data & Analytics, via email.

Since you will be employed by an airline and must have access to the airport area, it is a prerequisite that you can be cleared through a security background check and maintain this security clearance.

We are looking forward to your application!

Sunclass Airlines is part of the Nordic Leisure Travel Group (NLTG), which consists of the tour operators Spies in Denmark, Ving and Globetrotter in Sweden, Ving in Norway, Tjäreborg in Finland and the hotel company Resorts & Hotels. Sunclass Airlines flies the majority of the travel group's guests to our charter destinations and has over 1.000.000 travelers per year.

Read more about us at sunclassairlines.dk.

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst (Expert IT Analyst) who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution design, maintainability and architecture of applications
Designing both near real-time data pipelines and pipeline for traditional analytics
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues and to explain implications, and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers, and properly document your design & solutions
Engaging with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is communicative and has skills to build relationships
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets, and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup (DK) or Helsinki (FI).

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team
Are an experienced analyst, always seeking the best solution


Your experience and background:


5-7 years of experience from designing data intensive solutions, data architectures and integration patterns
Understanding the importance of requirement elicitation techniques / analysis
Expert in ensuring that business requirements gets translated into functional and non-functional specifications
Excellent skills in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Understanding of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code
Understanding of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


It is beneficial if you know/have:


Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)


What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/10/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. Title: 🔍 BI-analyst med blik for både mennesker og forretning
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for data – og er du nysgerrig på forretningen bag tallene? Kan du oversætte behov og systemer til output, der skaber reel værdi og gør en forskel? Så er du måske vores næste kollega.

🚀 Din hverdag

Hos os handler BI ikke om dashboards i sig selv – men om at hjælpe forretningen med at tage bedre beslutninger. Du bliver bindeleddet mellem de mennesker, der har behovene, og den data, der kan besvare dem.

Du Kommer Til At


arbejde tæt sammen med kolleger på tværs af teams og fagligheder
forstå og omsætte forretningsmål samt behov til konkrete løsninger med den tilgængelige data
gøre komplekst data forståeligt, så de faktisk kan blive anvendt med lethed til indsigter
udfordre vanetænkning, når ting kan effektiviseres eller når dataen viser en anden vej
sikre, at vi prioriterer det vigtigste først – og skaber værdi hurtigt
hjælpe forretningen hen mod data democratisation for at dine kolleger selv kan forstå og bruge data i hverdagen – vi tror nemlig på, at data også skal leve uden for BI-teamet.


Det er ikke afgørende, om du har erfaring fra vores branche – men det er vigtigt, at du brænder for at skabe sammenhæng mellem data, mennesker og retning.

💬 Dit kommende team

Du bliver en del af Finance & BI teamet, hvor der er højt til loftet, masser af idéer og hvor vi sætter pris på både innovation, ansvarlighed og nysgerrighed. Du kommer til at referere til vores Finance Director Annie, og får en nøglerolle i at løfte vores datamodenhed samt gøre BI til en naturlig del af forretningens beslutningsgrundlag.

“Noget af det fedeste ved rollen er, at det man laver faktisk bliver brugt og skaber værdi for dine kollegaer i hverdagen – også bare de små ting. Du behøver ikke lave store forkromede løsninger for at gøre en forskel. Tilgængeligheden og lysten til at hjælpe, betyder virkelig noget for kollegerne.” – din kommende kollega i BI, Fillip

🤝 Sådan arbejder vi

Vi arbejder tæt sammen, både i vores eget team og med resten af organisationen. Det betyder, at du sjældent sidder alene med en opgave, og at dialog med forretningen er en naturlig del af hverdagen. Vi tror på, at det bedste sker i samspil mellem data, mennesker og forretning.

Du bliver en aktiv sparringspartner for forretningen og hjælper kolleger med at forstå og anvende data i praksis. Det handler ikke bare om at præsentere tal, men om at omsætte dem til meningsfulde fortællinger, der understøtter beslutninger og giver retning.

Vi har en pragmatisk tilgang: Vi prioriterer det vigtigste først og prøver tingene af i små, men værdifulde skridt. Det behøver ikke være perfekt fra start – hellere en MVP vi lærer af, end en løsning der aldrig kommer i brug.

Vi værdsætter nysgerrighed, faglig sparring og evnen til at stille spørgsmål. Vi hjælper hinanden med at finde retningen, når opgaven er kompleks eller løsningen ikke er givet på forhånd.

🛠️ Værktøjskassen

Vi Arbejder Bl.a. Med


BigQuery og Dataform til datamodellering
Tableau til visualisering, erfaring med lignende er et krav
SQL – som du skal være rigtig skarp til
Kendskab til AI/predictive analytics er et plus, men ikke et krav
Kendskab til ETL og integrationer er også en fordel


Du behøver ikke kunne det hele – men du skal have lyst til at lære og bygge videre på det, du kan.

👀 Vi forestiller os, at du


Har erfaring som BI-analyst eller lignende
Tænker forretningsmæssigt og forstår, hvordan data skaber værdi
Har stærke kommunikationsevner – og formidler data og løsninger på en måde, der giver mening for både non-techy og techy kolleger.
Er selvstændig og tager ansvar, men trives i samarbejdet
Har blik for de tendenser og mønstre, som ikke altid er tydelige ved første øjekast – og du bruger dem til at stille de rigtige spørgsmål.
Tænker i større helheder, ikke kun i enkeltstående løsninger


🤖AI-kompetencer

Som medstiftere af AI-Kompetencepagten og med vores adm. direktør som viceforperson i AI-Kompetencerådet, er vi drevet af en vision om at fremme AI-forståelse bredt, både internt og eksternt. Hos os er AI ikke bare et værktøj, men en mulighed for at tænke nyt, skabe forandring, og finde innovative løsninger til vores kunder og medarbejdere.

Hvis du er nysgerrig og ser AI som en vej til at gøre en forskel for dig selv, dine kollegaer og vores kunder, så vil vi gerne have dig med på vores rejse.

⚖️Sund work-life balance og gode udviklingsmuligheder

Du får stadig tid til familie og venner! Hos os går vi op i, at dit arbejdsliv og privatliv er i harmoni. Derfor har du rig mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra, når det giver mening. Derudover får du gode karriere- og udviklingsmuligheder, som vi understøtter med din individuelle udviklingsplan, kurser og videndeling på tværs af hele Visma.

Du bliver fri for at smøre madpakke, for vi har den lækreste frokostordning, og når du har spist for meget, kan du gå med dine kolleger i vores eget fitnesscenter og kæmpe dig tilbage til den gode samvittighed. Eller få inspiration til fysisk og mental træning samt kost enten individuelt eller sammen med dine kolleger via vores program Visma Health.

Vi er gode til at være sociale sammen, og vores fest/aktivitetsudvalg arrangerer ofte fredagsbarer og udflugter ud af huset. Vi har desuden en årlig, stor sommerfest, som holdes i fællesskab med alle danske Visma-selskaber.

🚀Vil du med på holdet?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst i toppen og fortæl, hvorfor du gerne vil arbejde hos os. Søg allerede i dag ved at klikke på ”Ansøg om dette job”.

Vores mission er at skabe diversitet i vores teams, og vi tilskynder til inklusion, accept og forståelse ved at ansætte personer, der bringer unikke perspektiver til vores virksomhed.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, kan du skrive til Fillip på fillip.andreasen@visma.com eller Berit på berit.sogaard@visma.com.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

🏢Din nye arbejdsplads

Carlsberg Byen er hjemstedet for samtlige af Vismas selskaber i hovedstadsområdet. Domicilet på 20.000 m² betegnes officielt som Emil Christian Hansen Hus og har plads til over 1100 medarbejdere. I daglig tale kalder vi domicilet for "Visma House", og det er placeret i gåafstand til både S-tog og metro.

Ud over store lyse kontorlokaler, rummer huset også atrium, gårdhaver, tagterrasse og kantine.

🔥Få plads blandt et hold af løn- og HR-ildsjæle

Hos Visma Enterprise er vi mere end 180 medarbejdere som servicerer mere end 1.300 kunder og deres 250.000 lønmodtagere. Vores kunder er primært mellemstore og store virksomheder med et behov for digitaliserede HRM-løsninger inden for personale-, løn-, tidsregistrering- og rekrutteringsprocesser.

Vi kan lidt af hvert og brænder for det vi laver. Alle arbejder vi sammen på kryds og tværs for at spille hinanden bedre. For vi tror på, at vi sammen skaber den bedste oplevelse for vores kunder og den bedste arbejdsplads for os alle!

🌐En del af noget meget stort

Visma er en af Europas førende udbydere af software og services, der forenkler og automatiserer administrative forretningsprocesser. Vi er stolte over at være del af Visma-familien, som har ca. 16.000 medarbejdere og 1,9 millioner kunder inden for den offentlige og private sektor fordelt over hele verden.
Show more
HTML:
Brænder du for data – og er du nysgerrig på forretningen bag tallene? Kan du oversætte behov og systemer til output, der skaber reel værdi og gør en forskel? Så er du måske vores næste kollega.

🚀 Din hverdag

Hos os handler BI ikke om dashboards i sig selv – men om at hjælpe forretningen med at tage bedre beslutninger. Du bliver bindeleddet mellem de mennesker, der har behovene, og den data, der kan besvare dem.

Du Kommer Til At

  • arbejde tæt sammen med kolleger på tværs af teams og fagligheder
  • forstå og omsætte forretningsmål samt behov til konkrete løsninger med den tilgængelige data
  • gøre komplekst data forståeligt, så de faktisk kan blive anvendt med lethed til indsigter
  • udfordre vanetænkning, når ting kan effektiviseres eller når dataen viser en anden vej
  • sikre, at vi prioriterer det vigtigste først – og skaber værdi hurtigt
  • hjælpe forretningen hen mod data democratisation for at dine kolleger selv kan forstå og bruge data i hverdagen – vi tror nemlig på, at data også skal leve uden for BI-teamet.

Det er ikke afgørende, om du har erfaring fra vores branche – men det er vigtigt, at du brænder for at skabe sammenhæng mellem data, mennesker og retning.

💬 Dit kommende team

Du bliver en del af Finance & BI teamet, hvor der er højt til loftet, masser af idéer og hvor vi sætter pris på både innovation, ansvarlighed og nysgerrighed. Du kommer til at referere til vores Finance Director Annie, og får en nøglerolle i at løfte vores datamodenhed samt gøre BI til en naturlig del af forretningens beslutningsgrundlag.

“Noget af det fedeste ved rollen er, at det man laver faktisk bliver brugt og skaber værdi for dine kollegaer i hverdagen – også bare de små ting. Du behøver ikke lave store forkromede løsninger for at gøre en forskel. Tilgængeligheden og lysten til at hjælpe, betyder virkelig noget for kollegerne.” – din kommende kollega i BI, Fillip

🤝 Sådan arbejder vi

Vi arbejder tæt sammen, både i vores eget team og med resten af organisationen. Det betyder, at du sjældent sidder alene med en opgave, og at dialog med forretningen er en naturlig del af hverdagen. Vi tror på, at det bedste sker i samspil mellem data, mennesker og forretning.

Du bliver en aktiv sparringspartner for forretningen og hjælper kolleger med at forstå og anvende data i praksis. Det handler ikke bare om at præsentere tal, men om at omsætte dem til meningsfulde fortællinger, der understøtter beslutninger og giver retning.

Vi har en pragmatisk tilgang: Vi prioriterer det vigtigste først og prøver tingene af i små, men værdifulde skridt. Det behøver ikke være perfekt fra start – hellere en MVP vi lærer af, end en løsning der aldrig kommer i brug.

Vi værdsætter nysgerrighed, faglig sparring og evnen til at stille spørgsmål. Vi hjælper hinanden med at finde retningen, når opgaven er kompleks eller løsningen ikke er givet på forhånd.

🛠️ Værktøjskassen

Vi Arbejder Bl.a. Med

  • BigQuery og Dataform til datamodellering
  • Tableau til visualisering, erfaring med lignende er et krav
  • SQL – som du skal være rigtig skarp til
  • Kendskab til AI/predictive analytics er et plus, men ikke et krav
  • Kendskab til ETL og integrationer er også en fordel

Du behøver ikke kunne det hele – men du skal have lyst til at lære og bygge videre på det, du kan.

👀 Vi forestiller os, at du

  • Har erfaring som BI-analyst eller lignende
  • Tænker forretningsmæssigt og forstår, hvordan data skaber værdi
  • Har stærke kommunikationsevner – og formidler data og løsninger på en måde, der giver mening for både non-techy og techy kolleger.
  • Er selvstændig og tager ansvar, men trives i samarbejdet
  • Har blik for de tendenser og mønstre, som ikke altid er tydelige ved første øjekast – og du bruger dem til at stille de rigtige spørgsmål.
  • Tænker i større helheder, ikke kun i enkeltstående løsninger

🤖AI-kompetencer

Som medstiftere af AI-Kompetencepagten og med vores adm. direktør som viceforperson i AI-Kompetencerådet, er vi drevet af en vision om at fremme AI-forståelse bredt, både internt og eksternt. Hos os er AI ikke bare et værktøj, men en mulighed for at tænke nyt, skabe forandring, og finde innovative løsninger til vores kunder og medarbejdere.

Hvis du er nysgerrig og ser AI som en vej til at gøre en forskel for dig selv, dine kollegaer og vores kunder, så vil vi gerne have dig med på vores rejse.

⚖️Sund work-life balance og gode udviklingsmuligheder

Du får stadig tid til familie og venner! Hos os går vi op i, at dit arbejdsliv og privatliv er i harmoni. Derfor har du rig mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra, når det giver mening. Derudover får du gode karriere- og udviklingsmuligheder, som vi understøtter med din individuelle udviklingsplan, kurser og videndeling på tværs af hele Visma.

Du bliver fri for at smøre madpakke, for vi har den lækreste frokostordning, og når du har spist for meget, kan du gå med dine kolleger i vores eget fitnesscenter og kæmpe dig tilbage til den gode samvittighed. Eller få inspiration til fysisk og mental træning samt kost enten individuelt eller sammen med dine kolleger via vores program Visma Health.

Vi er gode til at være sociale sammen, og vores fest/aktivitetsudvalg arrangerer ofte fredagsbarer og udflugter ud af huset. Vi har desuden en årlig, stor sommerfest, som holdes i fællesskab med alle danske Visma-selskaber.

🚀Vil du med på holdet?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst i toppen og fortæl, hvorfor du gerne vil arbejde hos os. Søg allerede i dag ved at klikke på ”Ansøg om dette job”.

Vores mission er at skabe diversitet i vores teams, og vi tilskynder til inklusion, accept og forståelse ved at ansætte personer, der bringer unikke perspektiver til vores virksomhed.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, kan du skrive til Fillip på fillip.andreasen@visma.com eller Berit på berit.sogaard@visma.com.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

🏢Din nye arbejdsplads

Carlsberg Byen er hjemstedet for samtlige af Vismas selskaber i hovedstadsområdet. Domicilet på 20.000 m² betegnes officielt som Emil Christian Hansen Hus og har plads til over 1100 medarbejdere. I daglig tale kalder vi domicilet for "Visma House", og det er placeret i gåafstand til både S-tog og metro.

Ud over store lyse kontorlokaler, rummer huset også atrium, gårdhaver, tagterrasse og kantine.

🔥Få plads blandt et hold af løn- og HR-ildsjæle

Hos Visma Enterprise er vi mere end 180 medarbejdere som servicerer mere end 1.300 kunder og deres 250.000 lønmodtagere. Vores kunder er primært mellemstore og store virksomheder med et behov for digitaliserede HRM-løsninger inden for personale-, løn-, tidsregistrering- og rekrutteringsprocesser.

🌐En del af noget meget stort

Visma er en af Europas førende udbydere af software og services, der forenkler og automatiserer administrative forretningsprocesser. Vi er stolte over at være del af Visma-familien, som har ca. 16.000 medarbejdere og 1,9 millioner kunder inden for den offentlige og private sektor fordelt over hele verden.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Requirements:




1. Good general understanding of IT principles such as Networks, Hardware and Domains.

2. Knowledge of Infrastructure (Data Center and Network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, H&E support.

3. Knowledge of server/client operations in a domain environment including Active Directory.

4. Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.

5. Hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, Rack and Stack of the equipment/cable.

6. Good Hands-on Experience in IMAC and Break-fix activities related to Infrastructure environment.

7. Ability to identify Excellent the right defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

8. Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking.

9. Experience with Tape Management activities.

10. Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure.

11. Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies.

12. Updating and Recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket Management System.

13. Coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.

14. Provide support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

15. Perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

16. Coordinate actual activity date and timings including arrival and departure times.

17. Carry all necessary tools, laptops etc. which might be needed to support issues in the infrastructure environment.

18. Labelling, Patching and Asset Tagging activities.







Deployment / In-Scope Configuration Items




• Servers (Virtual & Physical)

• Storage & Backup Devices

• Server Appliances

• Hyper Converged Infrastructure (E.g. Nutanix, Cisco UCS)

• Tape Storage Units

• Power Distribution Units rated 3KVA and below

• SAN Fabric Switches

• Network Switches

• KVM Units

• WAN Optimization Devices

• Firewalls

• Access Points

• Routers

• Physical Cabling

• Cable Management

• Cables which connect the device to itself, a peripheral, or a power/network port







Break-fix / Technical Tasks List




• Power Cycling

• Running Diagnostics Commands

• Conducting whole unit replacement

• Inserting/Removing Media

• Replacing Defective Components

• Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation

• Configuring Remote Access

• Basic Storage Array Configuration

• Replacing faulty cables

• Tape Management and Maintenance

• Rebooting routers, servers, storage devices or other equipment

• Providing loop-back cables in order to test circuits remotely

• Re-seating or replacing components or cables

• Cleaning fibers

• Identify/Analyze fiber issues by using OTDR/LSPM/VFL

• Installing loop backs

• Racking and de-racking and upgrade of any device installed.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Kolding Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Responsibilities:

1. Cleaning tools testing, reporting, install cables or optics for new circuits. physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).

2. Support network and server teams by assisting with rack and stack and running cables. Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support

3. Labelling, patching, and asset tagging activities, perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

4. Follow specific task instructions and provision necessary reporting as necessary and support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

5. Conduct failure analysis, perform functional testing of entire system/Identify failed Component, planned maintenance or circuit migration support.

6. Reseating or swapping new line cards

7. Making, crimping and testing RJ45 Copper Cables

BreakFix/Technical Task List:

1. Cleaning fibers, replace the faulty optical cable. Installing loopbacks, BER testing

2. Inserting/removing/replacing defective components. Linecards, Fibers, etc... Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation with RMA Processing.

3. Configuring remote access, basic storage array configuration, replacing faulty cables.

4. Rebooting linecards, chassis or reseating of cards/optics

5. Providing loop-back cables to test circuits remotely, re-seating or replacing components or cables

6. Power cycling, and conducting whole unit replacement.




Preferred Skillsets: Technical Experience:

1. hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, rack, and stack of the equipment/cable.

2. Infrastructure (Data center and network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, HS&E support.

3. Knowledge of Nokia, Ciena Hardware.

4. Understanding of ILA Hut jobsites

5. Good understanding of IT principles such as networks, hardware.

6. Fiber/Data/Copper cable installation and maintaining; include working with MPO fibers.

7. Hands-on experiences in IMAC and break-fix activities related to infrastructure environment.

8. Ability to identify defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:

  • Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
  • Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
  • Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
  • Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger

Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Group

Global Operations >>> Technology >>> Data & Insights

Reports To

Head of Data & Insights

LOCATION:

Hybrid/Remote (Based in country with STG Offices}

Position Summary

Do you want to make a real impact — not just write code, but build something that matters?

As a Data Engineer, you’ll help fuel global transformation; your work will bring clarity to chaos, connecting scattered data into a single source of truth that powers our next generation planning platform, o9.

If you’re driven by purpose, hungry to grow, and excited to see your work make a visible difference, this is where you belong.

As a Data Engineer, you will build and improve data pipelines for the o9 planning tool, ensuring clean, governed, and ready-to-use data from various sources. You’ll also contribute to broader platform development, supporting our data warehouse and other analytics initiatives.

You’ll be part of a global company on a bold data-driven transformation — shifting from gutfeel to insight, from silos to clarity. Your work will help shape how we plan, decide, and act at every level. This isn’t just about building pipelines; it’s about building trust in data, unlocking scale, and enabling smarter decisions across the business. You’ll play a real part in turning data into a true driver of change — and that change starts with you.

Key Responsibilities


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that deliver refined, high-quality data to our o9 planning platform
Consolidating and transforming data from multiple internal and external systems for planning and analytics use
Supporting and enhancing our data warehouse infrastructure , ensuring consistency and reliability of source data
Applying data validation rules , quality checks, and governance standards throughout the pipeline
Implementing and maintaining monitoring , alerting, and documentation to ensure system transparency and stability
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to continuously improve workflows, tools, and technical practices


Who We Are Looking For

A hands-on builder who thrives in a structured but evolving environment, that enjoys making things work — not just once, but reliably, and at scale.

You take pride in delivering clean, maintainable pipelines and are comfortable following guidance, standards, and best practices set by more senior engineers.

You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to grow your craft by working on real-world data challenges with business impact.

Key Skills & Experience


Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts such as ETL/ELT, data modeling and data patterns such as SCD, CDC, snapshots, partitioning etc.
Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities


Supplementary Skills & Experience


Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures , SAP BDC or Datasphere
Hands-on experience with Databricks or Microsoft Fabric
Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data


OUR VALUES


A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that’s always improving
Flexibility in how and where you work — remote, hybrid, or onsite
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være med til at sætte retningen inden for Jyske Banks fremtidige datafundament og bidrage til udviklingen af løsninger, der optimerer vores datahåndtering? Er du klar til at forme Jyske Banks Data Warehouse?

Jobbet

Du vil arbejde i et erfarent udviklingsteam, Data Warehouse - Bank, der udvikler, driver og vedligeholder Jyske Banks Data Warehouse. Vores mission er at udstille data, til at sikre at Jyske Bank kan træffe de bedst mulige beslutninger. Teamets opgaver løses i tæt samarbejde med vores interessenter.

I teamet arbejder vi med:



At forbedre det eksisterende Data Warehouse med nye datadomæner for at imødekomme interessenternes behov
At sikre balance mellem kvalitet og udviklingshastighed
At indgå i dialog med forretningsenhederne om ønsker til datamodeller, forretningslogik og præsentation af data, så det kan nedbrydes i logiske leverancer
En agil organisering med SCRUM events, som sikrer en medledende og løsningsorienteret teamkultur, med solidt fokus på videndeling og personlig udvikling.
Support og drift af Jyske Banks Data Warehouse



Vi er professionelle og gør os umage hver dag, og har et stort fokus på at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde. Vi forventer at alle bidrager med konstruktiv feedback og input til løsninger. Du vil få et grundigt introduktionsforløb, så du har det bedst mulige udgangspunkt for at komme godt i gang med opgaverne.

Vores ønsker:

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau og en stor interesse for Data Warehouse i en forretningsmæssig kontekst. Alternativt har du opnået tilsvarende akademiske færdigheder gennem erfaring. Du kan have et solidt kendskab til backend arkitektur og generelle udviklingsmetodikker.

Derudover forventer vi, at du:



Kender til Data Warehouse begreber og teknologier.
Har erfaring med SQL Server teknologi, T-SQL og SAS som programmeringssprog.
Har udviklet i ETL-værktøjer som SAS DI Studio eller lignende dataintegrationsværktøjer.
Bidrager med videndeling i teamet, hvor kompetenceudvikling og kontinuerlig læring er i fokus.
Har en solid forståelse for de nyeste teknologiske trends og værktøjer inden for Datawarehouse og formår at omsætte denne viden til forretningsmæssig værdi.
Er nysgerrig, dygtig analytisk og trives i et samarbejdsorienteret miljø, hvor du bidrager engageret med din faglige indsigt.



Det forventes desuden, at du er i stand til at formidle dig selv tydeligt på dansk.

Teamet Data Warehouse Bank holder til i Jyske Banks hjemsted i Silkeborg, samt i Glaskuben (Kalvebod Brygge 3, København), og du vælger selv hvilken lokation der passer dig bedst.

Hverdagen er organiseret i et hybrid setup, men vi prioriterer også at samle de to lokationer for at sikre sammenhængskraften i teamet.

Ansøgning

Vi oplever mangfoldighed som en fordel i vores opgaveløsning og i vores fællesskab. Derfor opfordrer vi alle til at søge.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning, hvor du beskriver netop dine færdigheder i forhold til jobbet. Send et motiveret CV til os inden ansøgningsfristen d. 17. august.

HR Partner Stine Odgaard Ranum, vil tage sig af din ansøgning

Mere information

Interesseret? Har du spørgsmål om jobbet, så kan du ringe og få mere at vide:

Jesper Schaadt

Chapter Lead Afdeling: Data Warehouse

Telefon: 25 65 26 70
Show more

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineering
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Again

At Again, we are tackling one of the planet’s most pressing issues— waste CO2 —by transforming emissions into the solution. Our innovative approach involves fermenting industrial waste gases into carbon-negative chemicals, thereby turning harmful emissions into valuable, emission-free green chemicals. With each tonne of product we create, we remove over 2 tonnes of carbon from the atmosphere. Backed by over $100 million in funding from top venture capital investors and the European Union’s Horizon 2020 programme, we’re poised for rapid growth and global impact. If you think we’re doomed - think Again

What you'll do


Continuous updating of databases for experimental data, ensuring integrity and completeness of raw and metadata
Writing basic data wrangling and analysis scripts
10-15 hours per week, consistent availability 2 days per week required, flexible around class schedule and exams periods.


About You


Undergraduate degree in a subject with data science/coding component (e.g. data science, statistics, computational biology)
Coding experience in R and/or Python and ideally SQL
Understanding of best practices in data management
Strong attention to detail, ability to work independently
Preferred:
Some knowledge of biology/experimental data
Basic experience with cloud data storage and cloud computing

What we promise you?


You get to work with a group of passionate scientists, working on challenging and meaningful projects
An inclusive, empowering and engaging work environment
This will be the journey of a lifetime – we are serious about our mission to reduce over 1 gigaton of CO₂ and you can play a pivotal role in making that happen


If you have questions regarding the role, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out at hej@again.bio. We look forward to hearing from you.
Show more
