Title: Go-To-Market Analyst (UK, full-time, Copenhagen-based)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown 330% over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Dishoom, Wahaca, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Scale Capital, Nordic Makers, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: GTM Analyst

We are looking for a Go-To-Market Analyst for our UK market, full-time.

You are likely early in your career and want a full-time position that will give you a great boost in your professional development.

You’ll be responsible for business development, including outbound emailing / calling (i.e., cold canvassing) and creating partnerships to drive opportunities.

You'll work mostly on the UK market but might also target other countries.

The sales team has grown significantly over the past 12 months and is already filled with talented and ambitious people - one is a former Olympic medallist, others have previously founded startups. You’ll be part of this journey and help shape an incredible, sales-focused culture across the company.

😎 The job and responsibilities

Daily activities include:


Pipeline Generation:
Sourcing leads and researching new prospects to target
Reaching out to these leads with a multi-channel approach (think LinkedIn, phone, e-mails) - note that phone is a key ingredient here
Generating qualified meetings for the commercial team
Ensuring a smooth handover process from you to AE
Using the best-in-class tools for creative prospecting
Attending the meetings you are booking, together with the AE, for a steep learning curve


All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & you love to hit targets. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to make sales happen and be a team player.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We expect you to:


Speak and write English fluently
Have some sales experience or the willingness to get into an outbound sales environment (and be able to communicate why!)
Nice to have: B2B sales experience within SAAS / software sales
Be ambitious - you love hitting targets and are able to self-motivate!
Be bold - you’re not afraid to pick up the phone to get to tell people about All Gravy
Have excellent communication skills
Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there


We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply!

💎 What we offer

We are a motivated, young, and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment, we are 35 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

We have all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!
Show more

Title: Data management og udvikling
Description:
Vi søger en person der vil arbejde med data og forretninger og skabe en bro mellem dem. Vi er et lille team der udvikler tools til at behandle store data mængder og vi arbejder både med AWS og Azure og store transformationer af data.

Udover at lave tools til data håndtering hjælper vi også vores kunder med at forstå hvordan de kan bruge deres data og opnå deres mål med smart brug af data.

Vores mål er at lave big data tools både til transformering af data samt brug af data (bla indenfor AI). Ambitionen er at have de bedste tools på hånden og blive ved med at forbedre dem til fremtiden – hele tiden i en form der er nemt tilgængelig for kunder og ikke-tekniske samarbejdspartnere.

Det er et lille team så der er god plads til at vokse – både som generalist og som specialist indenfor udvalgte områder.




Hvem er IO Group?

Vi er IO Group – et konsulenthus, der hjælper forsikringsselskaber med at blive skarpere, hurtigere og mere innovative. Vi bygger smarte løsninger, automatiserer processer og skubber branchen ind i fremtiden. Vi arbejder med Java script, Web teknologier (HTML + javascript primært), Webservices og AI-løsninger, og en stor del af jobbet handler om at opsætte og konfigurere forsikringssystemer.

Men vigtigst af alt: Vi tror på frihed under ansvar, godt humør og et arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi hjælper hinanden. Ingen stive hierarkier eller kedelige mandagsmøder her!




Hvem er du?

Vi forestiller os, at du:

✅ Er vant til at arbejde med data og forståelsen af data

✅ Har arbejdet med cloud værktøjer – AWS og Azure

✅ Har arbejdet med Big data – ikke et krav, men en fordel

✅ Har arbejdet/interesse for transformation/ETL – ikke et krav, men en fordel

✅ Har forståelse for system arkitektur

✅ Er vant at arbejde i teams

✅ Ikke kun kode, men også tænker i løsninger og kvalitet.

✅ Tager ansvar – vi leder efter en, der følger opgaverne helt til dørs.




Hvad får du?

🚀 Masser af ansvar og frihed – du får chancen for at præge løsningerne og gøre en reel forskel.

🏡 Fleksibilitet – vi arbejder on-site, men der er altid plads til hjemmearbejde, når det giver mening.

🎉 Et arbejdsmiljø med plads til grin – vi tager vores arbejde seriøst, men ikke os selv.

🤖 Spændende teknologi – vi arbejder med AI-løsninger og nyeste tech, og du får mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer.

🍻 Sociale arrangementer – fordi vi tror på, at man arbejder bedst sammen, når man også har det sjovt sammen.




Hvordan søger du?

Du kan selvfølgelig sende en formel ansøgning her, men hvis du har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at skrive til os på mail, LinkedIn eller bare ringe, så er du meget velkommen! Vi vil hellere møde dig, som du er, end læse en generisk ansøgning.




Er du nysgerrig? Så giv lyd! 🚀




Show more
HTML:
Vi søger en person der vil arbejde med data og forretninger og skabe en bro mellem dem. Vi er et lille team der udvikler tools til at behandle store data mængder og vi arbejder både med AWS og Azure og store transformationer af data.

Udover at lave tools til data håndtering hjælper vi også vores kunder med at forstå hvordan de kan bruge deres data og opnå deres mål med smart brug af data.

Vores mål er at lave big data tools både til transformering af data samt brug af data (bla indenfor AI). Ambitionen er at have de bedste tools på hånden og blive ved med at forbedre dem til fremtiden – hele tiden i en form der er nemt tilgængelig for kunder og ikke-tekniske samarbejdspartnere.

Det er et lille team så der er god plads til at vokse – både som generalist og som specialist indenfor udvalgte områder.


Hvem er IO Group?

Vi er IO Group – et konsulenthus, der hjælper forsikringsselskaber med at blive skarpere, hurtigere og mere innovative. Vi bygger smarte løsninger, automatiserer processer og skubber branchen ind i fremtiden. Vi arbejder med Java script, Web teknologier (HTML + javascript primært), Webservices og AI-løsninger, og en stor del af jobbet handler om at opsætte og konfigurere forsikringssystemer.

Men vigtigst af alt: Vi tror på frihed under ansvar, godt humør og et arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi hjælper hinanden. Ingen stive hierarkier eller kedelige mandagsmøder her!


Hvem er du?

Vi forestiller os, at du:

✅ Er vant til at arbejde med data og forståelsen af data

✅ Har arbejdet med cloud værktøjer – AWS og Azure

✅ Har arbejdet med Big data – ikke et krav, men en fordel

✅ Har arbejdet/interesse for transformation/ETL – ikke et krav, men en fordel

✅ Har forståelse for system arkitektur

✅ Er vant at arbejde i teams

✅ Ikke kun kode, men også tænker i løsninger og kvalitet.

✅ Tager ansvar – vi leder efter en, der følger opgaverne helt til dørs.


Hvad får du?

🚀 Masser af ansvar og frihed – du får chancen for at præge løsningerne og gøre en reel forskel.

🏡 Fleksibilitet – vi arbejder on-site, men der er altid plads til hjemmearbejde, når det giver mening.

🎉 Et arbejdsmiljø med plads til grin – vi tager vores arbejde seriøst, men ikke os selv.

🤖 Spændende teknologi – vi arbejder med AI-løsninger og nyeste tech, og du får mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer.

🍻 Sociale arrangementer – fordi vi tror på, at man arbejder bedst sammen, når man også har det sjovt sammen.


Hvordan søger du?

Du kan selvfølgelig sende en formel ansøgning her, men hvis du har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at skrive til os på mail, LinkedIn eller bare ringe, så er du meget velkommen! Vi vil hellere møde dig, som du er, end læse en generisk ansøgning.

Title: Data Management Consultant
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Er du interesseret i data, og vil du gøre en reel forskel ved at rådgive virksomheder om brugbare indsigter baseret på fakta? Motiveres du af at være med, hvor det sker, og af at arbejde med nogle af de mest komplekse og moderne dataløsninger? Så er du måske vores nye kollega.

Arbejdsopgaver og teknologier

I Data Management vil du blive en del af et team, der bidrager til at vores kunder udvikler og administrerer deres forretning på baggrund af data og viden.

Du vil arbejde i spændet mellem teknikken og forretningen. Information og data er omdrejningspunktet for vores arbejde, og vi kan se, at vores analyser, rådgivning og endelige løsninger skaber værdi for vores kunder. Arbejde indebærer udvikling af tekniske løsninger til at indhente, behandle, modellere, analysere og fremvise data.

For bedst muligt at kunne rådgive og støtte vores kunder, har vi stort fokus på at holde os opdateret med de nyeste trends og teknologier indenfor Data Management. Du vil komme til at beskæftige dig med en bred palet af markedsudbredte teknologier, herunder: Azure SQL Server, Snowflake, dbt, Microsoft SQL Server m.fl.

Dine arbejdsopgaver er meget varierende og afhænger af dine færdigheder, og den vej du ønsker at udvikle dig. Eksempler herpå kan være:


Design, modellering og byg af datastrukturer såsom databaser
Strukturering og indsamling af data fra forskellige kilder
Implementering af forretningslogik på data til brug i rapportering
Kunderådgivning, strategiarbejde og forretningsanalyse i samarbejde med vores kunder
Udvikling af rapporter til forretningsbrugere med fokus på front-end


Om dig

Du er nyuddannet eller har op til et par års relevant erhvervserfaring med opgaver inden for Data Management. Gennem din uddannelse har du fået et fagligt fundament og logisk tilgang til at håndtere komplekse data og problemstillinger. Du trives i et udviklende miljø med fokus på samarbejde samt kontinuerlig personlig og professionel udvikling.

Derudover forestiller vi os, at du enten har erfaring med eller interessen for at lære forskellige værktøjer, som blandt andet:


ETL- og Database-teknologier
Sprog som forskellige versioner af SQL, Python og R
Business Intelligence-værktøjer: Power BI, Tableau m.fl.


Fortsæt din udvikling hos os

I Netcompany har vi fokus på din personlige og faglige udvikling.

Når du starter hos os, får du en personlig mentor, som vil vejlede dig igennem din udvikling og i at nå dine mål. Den tætte relation til en erfaren kollega er med til at sikre trivsel for den enkelte medarbejder og giver dig samtidig konkret indblik i de mange forskellige karrieremuligheder, efterhånden som du opbygger din erfaring.

Derudover deltager du i vores uddannelsesprogram, Netcompany Academy, hvor du tilbydes kurser og seminarer, om alt fra teknologier til kundehåndtering. Alle kurser undervises af erfarne Netcompany kolleger, hvilket er med til at sikre, at alt indhold er af høj relevans og bygger ovenpå din faglighed, så du bliver godt klædt på til at varetage forskellige opgaver og hele tiden dygtiggør dig gennem din karriere hos os.

Bliv en del af et inkluderende fællesskab

I Netcompany prioriterer vi fællesskab højt. Vi fremmer aktivt en åben og imødekommende arbejdskultur, der bygger på samarbejde og tillid til hinanden, og hvor der altid er mulighed for sparring.

Det er en del af vores kultur og værdigrundlag, at alle medarbejdere, uanset baggrund, identitet og erfaring mødes med forståelse og respekt samt lige muligheder for udvikling og trivsel.

Du får mulighed for at opnå læring og samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af kulturer og nationaliteter, da vi som international virksomhed har kontorer i mange lande.

Vi tilbyder et fælles miljø, hvor vi engagerer os i hinanden på tværs af afdelinger og projekter. Hertil har vi en lang række af sociale og faglige arrangementer, der giver dig de bedste muligheder for at udvide og opbygge et netværk allerede tidligt i din karriere.

Send os en ansøgning

Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning til vores rekrutteringssystem via linket. Har du ikke fået svar på alle dine spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at skrive til hr.dk@netcompany.com

Alle kvalificerede kandidater opfordres til at søge uanset køn, kønsudtryk, seksualitet, handicap, alder, religion og tro, politisk anskuelse, nationalitet, etnicitet eller sociale baggrund.

Vi er engagerede i at skabe et inkluderende og mangfoldigt miljø. Vores rekrutteringsprocesser er baseret på individuel merit. Hvis du har behov for tilpasninger eller ekstra støtte under ansættelsesprocessen, bedes du sende en e-mail til vores ansvarlige rekrutteringsmedarbejdere på reasonableadjustmentsdk@netcompany.com for hjælp.

Title: Your mind & our opportunities
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kære kandidat

Vi er hele tiden på udkig efter dygtige talenter og vurderer uopfordrede ansøgninger løbende. Så send os en ansøgning og fortæl os hvilken kategori af stilling du ønsker at søge og hvilken forskel du kan gøre for Nuuday.

Hvis vi finder din ansøgning interessant og relevant, vil du blive kontaktet af vores Talent Recruiter. Send også et CV, hvoraf det fremgår, hvad du har af kvalifikationer, uddannelse og erhvervserfaring. Så snart du har ansøgt, modtager du en bekræftelse på at vi har modtaget din ansøgning.

Bemærk dog, at du ikke kan forvente at høre nærmere inden for 3 uger, men vi

vender tilbage hvis vi har et job, der matcher din profil.

Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt. Efter seks måneder sletter vi din ansøgning, hvis der

ikke har været noget match i den pågældende periode.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday is a united family of strong and well-known brands with the shared purpose of making sense with technology. Our family consists of YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, Blockbuster, TDC Erhverv, NetDesign and Relatel, and together we represent the TV, broadband, network, telephony and entertainment of the future. We deliver innovative digital services to most Danish households and businesses. And we do it together. Across cross-functional teams, 33 nationalities and more than 4,000 unique colleagues. As Denmark’s leading digital service provider, we aspire to use technology to create a more meaningful future for our customers and society. Therefore, we are looking for the market’s brightest minds who dare to stand up and stand out.

Title: IT Supporter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:

Would you like to support a global business that operates non-stop, requires skilled colleagues and close attention? If yes, keep reading!

One of the most important aspects within IT is IT Support - we help our colleagues to do what they’re best at, by resolving the IT issues they face. If you’ve got the skills, mindset and the right experience, continue reading!

As an IT Supporter in Satair, you will join a team situated in Denmark, Singapore, China, Germany, and the US. We provide IT Support to our colleagues in the business on a 24/7 basis, by following the sun. As we are the first step into IT, guiding colleagues and leading them to our experts is also a discipline we practice. Therefore, this role entails on-call and weekend on-call shifts to provide our colleagues with seamless IT Support around the clock. In addition to the on-call shifts, you will also be a part of a rotating shift schedule, where you will be needed at work from 06:00 to 14:30 and an afternoon shift from 09:00 - 17:30

Within this year we’re planning to move our Warehouse operations to a different location, and as part of this move we need the IT Supporter role to move with it. You are therefore expected to be moving with the warehouse employees to the new warehouse located in Greve.

Your daily tasks will mainly consist of 2 areas (but is not limited to): Resolving IT Incidents and completing Service Requests.

What The Job Is ...

Your main responsibility is to support our colleagues in the business when we face IT issues or are given a Service Request. As you’re the first point of contact, the ambition to provide good customer service is a necessity and a timely resolution is a must.

Central aspects of the job:


Supporting your colleagues with IT Incidents and Service Requests
Drive and coordinate Major Incidents to ensure that we inform our colleagues (internally/externally) and get the Major Incident at hand resolved
Assist our colleagues in Infrastructure & Operations on tasks where hands are needed
Purchase equipment and ensure asset management is done according to our processes
Ensure that IAM activities are done with proper attention and care
Capture and share knowledge through written Knowledge Articles
Work closely with the different Service Desks within the organization of Airbus


What do you offer?

We’re looking for a candidate who likes the IT Support aspect in terms of helping users and making sure that our colleague got what was needed. A skill needed for the job is the ability to park your current task if an urgent issue arises and very importantly, remember to get back to where you left off. Due to the nature of IT Support, a certain part of our work comes with a level of unpredictability.

In our company, the aspect of IT Support spans wide from a technical perspective. General knowledge about IT is therefore a necessity in terms of Microsoft Operating Systems, Active Directory e.g. troubleshooting on DNS, Networking and general application understanding.

Your communication skills are important and that means you can engage in a dialogue with a skilled technician but also a colleague that has less understanding of IT than yourself. This will be needed in verbal and written form. On the written aspect, structure and an eye for detail is a plus.

We strive towards applying the principles of ITIL in our ITSM tool and you therefore need to be aware of the basics of ITIL Foundation.

As a person, your default answer to something unknown should not be ,, I don’t know...’’ but rather ,, I’ll investigate and return!’’. In some cases, patience is required and you will need it.

What are we looking for? How much experience? What type of experience?


Broad understanding of IT (hardware, software, network, communication)
A good understanding of the following will be an advantage:
Network topics such as DHCP, and DNS
Printer troubleshooting and Print Management
Ideally, experience with IT Asset Life Cycle Management (CMDB)
Ideally, experience with writing documentation, as this experience will be required when writing Knowledge Articles
ITIL Foundation certified
Bachelor or 1+ years experience within IT Support
Fluent in English both written and verbally
Written skills that demonstrates structure
Can offer valid references to attest your skills/personality

What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of over $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your CV and application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

Satair (a 100% subsidiary of Airbus) is offering first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. With our global functional organisation spanning across eleven different sites and locations worldwide, you will be part of a truly global family. Change is the only constant at Satair. The aviation industry is an ever changing - and fast moving environment.

That calls for someone special - someone like you!

Welcome to the Satair family!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Entry Level

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description:

Would you like to support a global business that operates non-stop, requires skilled colleagues and close attention? If yes, keep reading!

One of the most important aspects within IT is IT Support - we help our colleagues to do what they’re best at, by resolving the IT issues they face. If you’ve got the skills, mindset and the right experience, continue reading!

As an IT Supporter in Satair, you will join a team situated in Denmark, Singapore, China, Germany, and the US. We provide IT Support to our colleagues in the business on a 24/7 basis, by following the sun. As we are the first step into IT, guiding colleagues and leading them to our experts is also a discipline we practice. Therefore, this role entails on-call and weekend on-call shifts to provide our colleagues with seamless IT Support around the clock. In addition to the on-call shifts, you will also be a part of a rotating shift schedule, where you will be needed at work from 06:00 to 14:30 and an afternoon shift from 09:00 - 17:30

Within this year we’re planning to move our Warehouse operations to a different location, and as part of this move we need the IT Supporter role to move with it. You are therefore expected to be moving with the warehouse employees to the new warehouse located in Greve.

Your daily tasks will mainly consist of 2 areas (but is not limited to): Resolving IT Incidents and completing Service Requests.

What The Job Is ...

Your main responsibility is to support our colleagues in the business when we face IT issues or are given a Service Request. As you’re the first point of contact, the ambition to provide good customer service is a necessity and a timely resolution is a must.

Central aspects of the job:

  • Supporting your colleagues with IT Incidents and Service Requests
  • Drive and coordinate Major Incidents to ensure that we inform our colleagues (internally/externally) and get the Major Incident at hand resolved
  • Assist our colleagues in Infrastructure & Operations on tasks where hands are needed
  • Purchase equipment and ensure asset management is done according to our processes
  • Ensure that IAM activities are done with proper attention and care
  • Capture and share knowledge through written Knowledge Articles
  • Work closely with the different Service Desks within the organization of Airbus

What do you offer?

We’re looking for a candidate who likes the IT Support aspect in terms of helping users and making sure that our colleague got what was needed. A skill needed for the job is the ability to park your current task if an urgent issue arises and very importantly, remember to get back to where you left off. Due to the nature of IT Support, a certain part of our work comes with a level of unpredictability.

In our company, the aspect of IT Support spans wide from a technical perspective. General knowledge about IT is therefore a necessity in terms of Microsoft Operating Systems, Active Directory e.g. troubleshooting on DNS, Networking and general application understanding.

Your communication skills are important and that means you can engage in a dialogue with a skilled technician but also a colleague that has less understanding of IT than yourself. This will be needed in verbal and written form. On the written aspect, structure and an eye for detail is a plus.

We strive towards applying the principles of ITIL in our ITSM tool and you therefore need to be aware of the basics of ITIL Foundation.

As a person, your default answer to something unknown should not be ,, I don’t know...’’ but rather ,, I’ll investigate and return!’’. In some cases, patience is required and you will need it.

What are we looking for? How much experience? What type of experience?

  • Broad understanding of IT (hardware, software, network, communication)
    • A good understanding of the following will be an advantage:
      • Network topics such as DHCP, and DNS
      • Printer troubleshooting and Print Management
  • Ideally, experience with IT Asset Life Cycle Management (CMDB)
  • Ideally, experience with writing documentation, as this experience will be required when writing Knowledge Articles
  • ITIL Foundation certified
  • Bachelor or 1+ years experience within IT Support
  • Fluent in English both written and verbally
  • Written skills that demonstrates structure
  • Can offer valid references to attest your skills/personality
What does your next challenge look like?

At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation’s digital and sustainable transformation.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of over $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:

  • Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
  • Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
  • Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
  • Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your CV and application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

Satair (a 100% subsidiary of Airbus) is offering first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. With our global functional organisation spanning across eleven different sites and locations worldwide, you will be part of a truly global family. Change is the only constant at Satair. The aviation industry is an ever changing - and fast moving environment.

That calls for someone special - someone like you!

Welcome to the Satair family!

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Entry Level

Digital

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Kolding Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Responsibilities:

1. Cleaning tools testing, reporting, install cables or optics for new circuits. physical cabling, cable management, northbound cabling, (Fiber/Copper/Power).

2. Support network and server teams by assisting with rack and stack and running cables. Planned/Predictive maintenance or circuit migration support

3. Labelling, patching, and asset tagging activities, perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

4. Follow specific task instructions and provision necessary reporting as necessary and support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

5. Conduct failure analysis, perform functional testing of entire system/Identify failed Component, planned maintenance or circuit migration support.

6. Reseating or swapping new line cards

7. Making, crimping and testing RJ45 Copper Cables

BreakFix/Technical Task List:

1. Cleaning fibers, replace the faulty optical cable. Installing loopbacks, BER testing

2. Inserting/removing/replacing defective components. Linecards, Fibers, etc... Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation with RMA Processing.

3. Configuring remote access, basic storage array configuration, replacing faulty cables.

4. Rebooting linecards, chassis or reseating of cards/optics

5. Providing loop-back cables to test circuits remotely, re-seating or replacing components or cables

6. Power cycling, and conducting whole unit replacement.




Preferred Skillsets: Technical Experience:

1. hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, rack, and stack of the equipment/cable.

2. Infrastructure (Data center and network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, HS&E support.

3. Knowledge of Nokia, Ciena Hardware.

4. Understanding of ILA Hut jobsites

5. Good understanding of IT principles such as networks, hardware.

6. Fiber/Data/Copper cable installation and maintaining; include working with MPO fibers.

7. Hands-on experiences in IMAC and break-fix activities related to infrastructure environment.

8. Ability to identify defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Engineer with deep expertise in Databricks and Azure Data Factory to join our data team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing robust data pipelines that ingest, transform, and model data from our SAP systems into scalable and reusable data products. This role requires strong proficiency in PySpark and SQL, a solid understanding of data modelling principles, and hands-on experience with Databricks.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines using Databricks and Azure Data Factory.
Ingest and process data from SAP systems, ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability.
Model raw data into structured, reusable data products that support business intelligence and analytics use cases.
Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Optimize data workflows for performance and cost-efficiency in a cloud-native environment.
Implement best practices for data engineering, including version control, testing, and documentation.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure high availability and performance.
Communicate proactively and clearly with stakeholders, demonstrating a “can-do” attitude and a collaborative mindset.




Primary Skills (Must Have):

Databricks (5/5) – Extensive experience building and managing data pipelines and notebooks.
Azure Data Factory (5/5) – Strong expertise in orchestrating data workflows and integrating with various data sources.
Data Modelling (4/5) – Proficient in designing logical and physical data models for analytics and reporting.
PySpark (5/5) – Advanced programming skills for large-scale data processing.
SQL (5/5) – Expert-level skills in writing complex queries and optimizing performance.
Azure Synapse Analytics (4/5) – Experience with data warehousing and analytics solutions.




Secondary Skills (Nice to Have):

CI/CD for Data Pipelines (3/5) – Familiarity with DevOps practices in data engineering.
Delta Lake (3/5) – Knowledge of ACID transactions and time travel in Databricks.




Experience:

Total Experience: 5+ years in data engineering and analytics.
Relevant Experience: 3+ years working with Databricks and Azure Data Factory.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være med til at sætte retningen inden for Jyske Banks fremtidige datafundament og bidrage til udviklingen af løsninger, der optimerer vores datahåndtering? Er du klar til at forme Jyske Banks Data Warehouse?

Jobbet

Du vil arbejde i et erfarent udviklingsteam, Data Warehouse - Bank, der udvikler, driver og vedligeholder Jyske Banks Data Warehouse. Vores mission er at udstille data, til at sikre at Jyske Bank kan træffe de bedst mulige beslutninger. Teamets opgaver løses i tæt samarbejde med vores interessenter.

I teamet arbejder vi med:



At forbedre det eksisterende Data Warehouse med nye datadomæner for at imødekomme interessenternes behov
At sikre balance mellem kvalitet og udviklingshastighed
At indgå i dialog med forretningsenhederne om ønsker til datamodeller, forretningslogik og præsentation af data, så det kan nedbrydes i logiske leverancer
En agil organisering med SCRUM events, som sikrer en medledende og løsningsorienteret teamkultur, med solidt fokus på videndeling og personlig udvikling.
Support og drift af Jyske Banks Data Warehouse



Vi er professionelle og gør os umage hver dag, og har et stort fokus på at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde. Vi forventer at alle bidrager med konstruktiv feedback og input til løsninger. Du vil få et grundigt introduktionsforløb, så du har det bedst mulige udgangspunkt for at komme godt i gang med opgaverne.

Vores ønsker:

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau og en stor interesse for Data Warehouse i en forretningsmæssig kontekst. Alternativt har du opnået tilsvarende akademiske færdigheder gennem erfaring. Du kan have et solidt kendskab til backend arkitektur og generelle udviklingsmetodikker.

Derudover forventer vi, at du:



Kender til Data Warehouse begreber og teknologier.
Har erfaring med SQL Server teknologi, T-SQL og SAS som programmeringssprog.
Har udviklet i ETL-værktøjer som SAS DI Studio eller lignende dataintegrationsværktøjer.
Bidrager med videndeling i teamet, hvor kompetenceudvikling og kontinuerlig læring er i fokus.
Har en solid forståelse for de nyeste teknologiske trends og værktøjer inden for Datawarehouse og formår at omsætte denne viden til forretningsmæssig værdi.
Er nysgerrig, dygtig analytisk og trives i et samarbejdsorienteret miljø, hvor du bidrager engageret med din faglige indsigt.



Det forventes desuden, at du er i stand til at formidle dig selv tydeligt på dansk.

Teamet Data Warehouse Bank holder til i Jyske Banks hjemsted i Silkeborg, samt i Glaskuben (Kalvebod Brygge 3, København), og du vælger selv hvilken lokation der passer dig bedst.

Hverdagen er organiseret i et hybrid setup, men vi prioriterer også at samle de to lokationer for at sikre sammenhængskraften i teamet.

Ansøgning

Vi oplever mangfoldighed som en fordel i vores opgaveløsning og i vores fællesskab. Derfor opfordrer vi alle til at søge.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning, hvor du beskriver netop dine færdigheder i forhold til jobbet. Send et motiveret CV til os inden ansøgningsfristen d. 17. august.

HR Partner Stine Odgaard Ranum, vil tage sig af din ansøgning

Mere information

Interesseret? Har du spørgsmål om jobbet, så kan du ringe og få mere at vide:

Jesper Schaadt

Chapter Lead Afdeling: Data Warehouse

Telefon: 25 65 26 70
Show more

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Initiate søger en ny kollega!




Vi er et konsulenthus på Kultorvet, der hjælper virksomheder med alt fra 50 til 5000 ansatte med at udnytte deres data til at træffe bedre beslutninger. Vi har 9 år bag os og er knap 30 mennesker, som grundlæggende tror på, at udgangspunktet for at levere fantastiske produkter til kunderne er en fantastisk arbejdsplads.




Vi vil gerne tilbyde nye kollegaer en anderledes ansættelsesproces, fordi vi godt kan lide et andet perspektiv. Derfor foreslår vi, at du sender os nogle linjer der fortæller om et konkret projekt, du er særligt stolt af, samt en kort beskrivelse af den seneste gang, du gjorde en forskel for en kollega. Du er også velkommen til at gøre noget helt tredje – vi leder efter initiativ og proaktiv kant.




Du skal søge et job hos Initiate, fordi vi prioriterer din udvikling. Det gør vi ved at tilbyde fleksibilitet og højt til loftet, og ved konkret at koble dig på implementeringsprojekter, der matcher dine kompetencer og læringsmål. Her vil du kunne bygge dataplatforme fra bunden med et metodisk fundament, der spænder fra Ralph Kimballs data warehouse-principper til Barbara Mintos måde at strukturere problemløsning og kommunikation.




Men hvad forventer Initiate så mere konkret fra dig?

I hjertet af Initiate er der teknisk faglighed med fokus på de klassiske elementer fra data-værktøjskassen, så selvfølgelig har du både erfaring med en bred vifte af tools og en dyb forståelse for nogle stykker. Det betyder, at du i praksis har implementeret Databricks eller Fabric, kodet en API-integration i Python og bygget pipelines fra kilde til kunde.

Hos vores kunder fungerer vores løsninger som rygraden, både i de daglige forretningsprocesser og i den digitale omstilling. Vi ønsker at styrke vores indsats inden for en række spændende områder, så vi i endnu højere grad kan omdanne komplekse data til målbar forretningsværdi. Det kan du hjælpe med, hvis du kan se dig selv i noget af det følgende, hvor dine færdigheder rækker langt ud over dine tekniske evner:




Du engagerer dig proaktivt i kundens behov og sørger for at understøtte de flaskehalse der måtte være I alle stadier af projektarbejdet.
Du brænder for tekniske udfordringer, der skubber grænser, samtidig med at du sætter det menneskelige samspil i højsædet. Du ved, at bløde og hårde skills ikke er hinandens modsætninger, men forudsætninger for, at du lykkedes med at skabe resultater.
Endelig tager du initiativ til at gøre Initiate til et levende og inspirerende sted at arbejde. Det kan være gennem faglige fredage, uformelle sparringssessioner eller andre små forbedringer, der gør Initiate til et sted, man elsker at være.




Så hvad gør du herfra?

Glem den traditionelle ansøgning, og send i stedet dine eksempler som beskrevet ovenfor. Hvis du har spørgsmål er du meget velkommen til at række ud til hiring manager Frederik Hye-Hestvang på 60146562 eller fhh@initiate.dk.




Vi glæder os til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til at Initiate fortsat leverer stærke produkter til vores kunder og bliver en endnu bedre arbejdsplads.

Show more

Derfor foreslår vi, at du sender os nogle linjer der fortæller om et konkret projekt, du er særligt stolt af, samt en kort beskrivelse af den seneste gang, du gjorde en forskel for en kollega. Du er også velkommen til at gøre noget helt tredje – vi leder efter initiativ og proaktiv kant.


Du skal søge et job hos Initiate, fordi vi prioriterer din udvikling. Det gør vi ved at tilbyde fleksibilitet og højt til loftet, og ved konkret at koble dig på implementeringsprojekter, der matcher dine kompetencer og læringsmål. Her vil du kunne bygge dataplatforme fra bunden med et metodisk fundament, der spænder fra Ralph Kimballs data warehouse-principper til Barbara Mintos måde at strukturere problemløsning og kommunikation.


Men hvad forventer Initiate så mere konkret fra dig?

I hjertet af Initiate er der teknisk faglighed med fokus på de klassiske elementer fra data-værktøjskassen, så selvfølgelig har du både erfaring med en bred vifte af tools og en dyb forståelse for nogle stykker. Det betyder, at du i praksis har implementeret Databricks eller Fabric, kodet en API-integration i Python og bygget pipelines fra kilde til kunde.

Hos vores kunder fungerer vores løsninger som rygraden, både i de daglige forretningsprocesser og i den digitale omstilling. Vi ønsker at styrke vores indsats inden for en række spændende områder, så vi i endnu højere grad kan omdanne komplekse data til målbar forretningsværdi. Det kan du hjælpe med, hvis du kan se dig selv i noget af det følgende, hvor dine færdigheder rækker langt ud over dine tekniske evner:


  • Du engagerer dig proaktivt i kundens behov og sørger for at understøtte de flaskehalse der måtte være I alle stadier af projektarbejdet.
  • Du brænder for tekniske udfordringer, der skubber grænser, samtidig med at du sætter det menneskelige samspil i højsædet. Du ved, at bløde og hårde skills ikke er hinandens modsætninger, men forudsætninger for, at du lykkedes med at skabe resultater.
  • Endelig tager du initiativ til at gøre Initiate til et levende og inspirerende sted at arbejde. Det kan være gennem faglige fredage, uformelle sparringssessioner eller andre små forbedringer, der gør Initiate til et sted, man elsker at være.


Så hvad gør du herfra?

Glem den traditionelle ansøgning, og send i stedet dine eksempler som beskrevet ovenfor. Hvis du har spørgsmål er du meget velkommen til at række ud til hiring manager Frederik Hye-Hestvang på 60146562 eller fhh@initiate.dk.


Vi glæder os til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til at Initiate fortsat leverer stærke produkter til vores kunder og bliver en endnu bedre arbejdsplads.

Title: Analysekonsulent
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Om stillingen

Vi søger en konsulent, der brænder for at skabe viden, der gør en forskel. Du skal kunne arbejde selvstændigt med kvantitative analyser og formidle resultaterne klart og tilgængelig – både til beslutningstagere og offentligheden. Du vil være en del af Madkulturens erfarne vidensteam og bidrage til både brede befolkningsundersøgelser og målrettede analyser af specifikke målgrupper. Du kommer til at arbejde med dataindsamling, analyse og evaluering af vores projekter og indsatser.




Dine opgaver:

·        Udvikling og gennemførelse af kvantitative spørgeskemaundersøgelser

·        Statistiske analyser af befolkningsdata og projektdata

·        Udvikling og gennemførelse af kvalitative dataindsamlinger (fx interviews og fokusgrupper)

·        Design og gennemførelse af procesevalueringer og virkningsevalueringer

·        Formidling af data og analyseresultater på en klar og tilgængelig måde – både skriftligt og mundtligt




Dine kvalifikationer:

·        Relevant samfundsvidenskabelig uddannelse (fx sociologi, statskundskab eller lignende)

·        Minimum 3 års erfaring med analyser og evaluering

·        Dokumenteret erfaring med kvantitative analyser og gerne surveydesign

·        Kendskab til mixed methods og evalueringsmetoder

·        Evne til at omsætte komplekse data til praksisnær og meningsfuld formidling




Vi tilbyder:

·        En meningsfuld stilling i en organisation, der arbejder for at skabe positive forandringer i samfundet

·        Et engageret og tværfagligt team med stærke værdier og høj faglighed

·        Mulighed for at præge arbejdet og sætte dine kompetencer i spil i konkrete projekter




Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så glæder vi os til at modtage din ansøgning! 




Ansøg via:

https://candidate.hr-manager.net/ApplicationInit.aspx?cid=5001&ProjectId=189981&DepartmentId=7670&MediaId=5

Title: CRM Performance & Optimisation Specialist
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you interested in helping to grow our LEGO® Membership base, by bringing play into more people's everyday lives and join a value driven company in an exciting global role?

Join us for an exciting career as “CRM Performance & Optimisation Specialist” as part of the newly established Membership & Personalisation team within LEGO® Market & Channels Global Marketing.

Please note the work location is Copenhagen, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.

As we approach the holiday season, please note that there may be delays in the recruitment process. We thank you for your patience and understanding during this period.


Core Responsibilities





Establish and execute reporting processes to track the key performance metrics related to CRM campaigns, programmes and initiatives.
Analyse ongoing optimisation of CRM campaigns to drive member engagement, retention, lifetime value and maximise commercial value.
Monitor CRM performance against targets and goals, identifying areas of underperformance and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Establish KPIs and reporting frameworks to measure campaign performance and customer lifecycle metrics, in partnership with Performance & Development Team.
Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities to streamline reporting and optimisation efforts.
Identify trends and customer insights through data analysis, applying these learnings to enhance customer targeting and communications.
Work closely with the Performance & Development Team to deep dive into CRM audience profiles, developments in audience behaviours, and the drivers of campaign performance.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The CRM Performance & Optimisation Specialist will be help drive the reporting and optimization of the LEGO Group CRM activities, including KPI performance reporting & framework, ensuring they deliver maximum efficiency and effectiveness.

The role will sit within the Global Membership & Personalisation Team, with a broader responsibility to empower and inspire the full LEGO Group. You will report directly to the Manager, CRM Performance & Optimisation.

Do you have what it takes?





Experience in CRM, with a specific focus on leading performance analysis and campaign optimisation.
CRM platform experience (ideally Salesforce), analytics platforms (ideally Adobe) and an overall understanding of marketing automation tools.
Experience developing & delivering reporting and optimisation recommendations to deliver commercial results and member satisfaction.
Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis and customer segmentation.
Demonstrated success in utilising A/B testing, personalisation, and analytics to improve CRM performance.
Excels at communicating with stakeholders (written & oral); able to convey simple recommendations based on solid foundation.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Specialist, Paid Social
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Paid Social expert with a passion for consulting eCommerce and retail, eager to continue sharpening your skills and stay ahead of the industry?

We’re looking for a Paid Social Specialist to join our team in Copenhagen. If you’re action-oriented, performance-driven, and eager to help clients grow on Social platforms, we’d love to hear from you!


About the Role
As a Paid Social Specialist, you will join our Paid Social team and help shape strategy, own campaign execution, and drive performance across a portfolio of clients. You’ll collaborate with the wider s360 Group and other specialist teams to bring big ideas to life while focusing on delivering tangible results.


Key Responsibilities

Client Management:You will be managing a portfolio of clients, sometimes in a joint collaboration with a more senior lead or independently with support from your manager.
Strategy: Lead Paid Social strategy for clients, ensuring alignment with broader commercial goals. Develop and optimise channel plans, proactively identifying opportunities, challenges, and solutions.
Campaign Management: Manage day-to-day campaign performance, from structure to pacing, creative testing, reporting, and platform hygiene. Implement tests and refine execution based on performance data.



What we’re looking for

Paid Social Expertise: Experience with Meta, TikTok, SnapChat, and Pinterest Ads Management including planning, execution, and optimisation.
Stakeholder Management: Comfortable building client relationships and managing expectations with clients, providing best-in-class consulting.
Innovative Mindset: Passionate about staying ahead of trends and solving challenges with new technologies.
Collaboration & Communication: Team-oriented, with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to engage stakeholders effectively.
Language Skills: Fluent in Danish and English (both written and spoken).





Meet your future team

Join a dynamic Social team of Directors, Seniors, and Specialists who share a commitment to delivering exceptional results. We foster a collaborative environment where personal and professional growth is key, and you’ll stay on the cutting edge of Social Media Marketing.




What we offer

The opportunity to shape the future of a rapidly growing agency.
A supportive, growth-oriented environment with talented colleagues.
Freedom to work flexibly and hybrid.
Social events to bond with your colleagues and grow your network.
Individual development plan that will make sure you grow your skills within the technical and consulting aspects of Paid Social.


Interested?

Does this sound like the right fit for you? Do you have any questions? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Director of Paid Social, Christian Toftegaard, at cjt@s360digital.com. 

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.




About s360
s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Fully Remote)

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a key role in driving strategic insights and evolving our data environment. This fully remote position offers the opportunity to collaborate across departments, supporting both day-to-day operations and broader strategic initiatives—especially as we modernise systems and strengthen our reporting capabilities.

Our current data stack includes SQL Server and Power BI, with complex data models and pipelines. Projects will span business intelligence, data science, and advanced analytics. If you’re someone who can quickly get to grips with existing systems, understand data logic, and communicate insights clearly, this role could be a great fit.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to identify analytical needs and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Collaborate across teams to uncover growth opportunities and provide statistical and business analysis.
Design, develop, and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using SQL Server and Power BI.
Support the development of a modern data strategy, including system upgrades and migrations.
Help standardise metrics, documentation, and reporting logic across the organisation.

What You’ll Bring

Advanced SQL skills, with hands-on experience working in SQL Server environments.
Strong ownership mindset and a proactive, solutions-focused approach.
Proven experience designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards and data models.
Ability to work with complex datasets and apply business logic to analytical outputs.
Excellent communication skills—you can clearly explain data insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Solid grounding in statistics, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modelling.
Bonus: Experience with ERP systems or large-scale data migrations.
Bonus: Background in e-commerce or service-oriented operations.

Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Business Insights Analyst

Role Type: Temporary – 6 Months – Full Time

Location: London – St. Pancras – x3 Days On-Site per week / x2 days Working Remote







Your New Company




As a Business Insights Analyst you will be working within the UK Oncology Insights and Analytics team to provide relevant insights and analysis to enable an optimal diagnosis of our business performance.




In this regard, the Business Insights Analyst will be responsible for analysing different data sources (sales data, competitive insights, activity, etc.) to generate insights aimed at delivering competitive advantage. In addition, the incumbent will also contribute to critical business processes connected to data automation, brand planning and financial planning.







Your New Role




Generate insights on patients, customers and NHS as well as brands, markets and TA by analysing multiple data sources to inform and influence business decisions
Deliver performance analytics on priority brands by (1) identifying patterns within the data, (2) uncovering insights / brand opportunities and (3) articulate useful recommendations
Support strategic planning and financial planning processes
Support data and analytics automation processes
Working closely with the BUs, develop a thorough understanding of current key business issues and provide solutions to support BU decision making
Proactively identifies blind spots and opportunities in terms of unanswered business questions and insights
Drive compliant processes according to AZ SoPs and Code of conduct




Essential Skills




3 to 5 years of experience in analytical or insights generation roles
Analytical skills, strong excel + power point skills
Knowledge of NHS and the pharma industry – Oncology advantageous
Ability to distil impactful insights out of different data
Proven track record of working with senior stakeholders in a complex environment
Self-starter who can face challenges with positive attitude




Desirable Skills




Oncology knowledge / experience
Experience with PowerBI
Pharma Sales & Marketing experience







WHY ASTRAZENECA?




It's an exciting time to join AstraZeneca, a global business that's rapidly growing - there's a lot happening and even more to come. And we are a valued part of this journey. Respected partners across the business, we provide the platform that's going to power us to achieve more.




So, what's next?




Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it's yours. Please apply with a copy of your CV.

Show more

Data Analyst

Location: London - Flexible working



Data Idols are working with a fast-growing, product-led tech company to hire a Data Analyst to join their growing team. This is a key role in the team and this person will directly impact their customers.



The Opportunity



The team this person is joining is playing a key role in the companies data journey. You will directly impact the customers by supporting the business with insights and self serve data tools. Salary: £70K - £80K



Location: London - Flexible working

Data Idols are working with a fast-growing, product-led tech company to hire a Data Analyst to join their growing team. This is a key role in the team and this person will directly impact their customers.

The Opportunity

The team this person is joining is playing a key role in the companies data journey. You will directly impact the customers by supporting the business with insights and self serve data tools. You'll be part of a company that takes data seriously, where your work has direct impact on product quality, decision making, and customer outcomes.

Skills and Experience

  • Strong experience working with Looker
  • SQL
  • Python
  • dbt knowledge

If you are looking for a new challenge, then please submit your CV for initial screening and more details.

Data Analyst


Desired Skills and Experience

Looker|SQL|dbt

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
To maintain completeness and accuracy of inventory expenses in the team’s ERP system, ensuring compliance with financial standards and FIA Financial Regulations requirements. Enable the business to produce accurate and timely reporting on inventory spend to allow efficient and high-quality business decisions.

This is a 6-month fixed term contract with the potential to extend.

Main Duties:


Using system stock ageing reports and liaising with the business, identify items of stock that have been Used or are deemed Redundant, and write these costs off to the P&L on a daily basis
Use counting reason codes to correctly allocate costs to the appropriate Cost Cap activity dimension, understanding the different scenarios and compliant treatment requirements, and setting up new reason codes where necessary
Maintain appropriate process documentation and audit evidence for postings made in the system, including system warehouse location reference file
Identify and raise any master data or process issues to the inventory IPT as these are found
Work with inventory IPT and other teams as appropriate to test automation of processes as required


Key Accountabilities:

Fulfil all organisational expectations, including but not limited to the following:


Understand and work in line with Williams Values & Behaviours, encouraging others to do the same.
Ensure understanding of and compliance with health and safety obligations.
Maintain personal high standards of behaviour and conduct, being a positive ambassador for the department.
Ensure you adhere to brand rules and maintain high standards of department presentation.
Work to quality standards and identify and contribute ways to continuously improve department and personal performance.
Ensure understanding of cost cap rules and requirements.


Core Competencies:


Analytically minded and methodical worker with strong attention to detail
Process oriented and able to demonstrate good problem-solving skills
Ability to establish good working relationships with stakeholders across multiple functional areas
Inquisitive; ability to identify improvements and challenge existing standards
Self-starter with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
Good team player with an approachable professional manner
Flexible approach to working hours in line with fluctuating work requirements


Qualifications and Experience Level:


Data processing experience
Good attention to detail
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Experience working in an ERP or production management system


This job description is not exhaustive, and the job holder will be required to carry out from time-to-time tasks in addition to the above that will be both reasonable and within their capabilities.

Company Description

For almost 50 years, Atlassian Williams Racing has been at the forefront of one of the fastest sports on the planet, being one of the top three most successful teams in history competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship. With an almost unrivalled heritage of engineering and racing F1 cars and unforgettable eras that demonstrate it is a force to be reckoned with, the British squad boasts 16 F1 World Championship titles to its name.

Since its foundation in 1977 by the eminent, late Sir Frank Williams and engineering pioneer Sir Patrick Head, the team has won nine Constructors’ Championships, in association with Cosworth, Honda and Renault. Its roll call of drivers is legendary, with its seven Drivers’ Championship trophies being lifted by true icons of the sport: Alan Jones, Keke Rosberg, Nelson Piquet, Nigel Mansell, Alain Prost, Damon Hill and Jacques Villeneuve. The team has made history before and is out to make it again with a long-term mission to evolve and return to the front of the grid.

Additional Information

Atlassian Williams Racing is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We are happy to discuss reasonable job adjustments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (NHS SQL + Power BI)

CereCore International — United Kingdom (Remote)

6-month consultancy engagement

Remote (UK-based)

August / September start date

Day Rate (Outside IR35)




CereCore International partners with NHS organisations to deliver modern, data-driven solutions that support operational and clinical improvement. We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to support an NHS Trust on a time-sensitive reporting and data performance improvement project.




This role will focus heavily on working with NHS data sets (including commissioning datasets and statutory returns), optimising SQL-based reporting packages, and providing visibility across operational and performance data flows.




Key Responsibilities

Deliver high-quality reporting using SQL and Power BI, aligned with national reporting standards
Support mandatory and statutory reporting across detailed NHS data sets
Work with operational and acute BI teams to improve reporting accuracy and reliability
Troubleshoot and validate data issues across live and historic datasets
Assist in building automated pipelines and reporting packages to streamline outputs
Collaborate with clinical and performance stakeholders to clarify data requirements and deliver actionable insights
Provide guidance on NHS dataset structures and commissioning data requirements




Required Skills & Experience

Strong command of SQL for querying, joining, and transforming large NHS data sets
Proven experience building dashboards and reports using Power BI
Deep understanding of NHS commissioning data sets, performance metrics, and reporting standards
Experience working within or alongside Acute BI teams
Strong attention to detail and ability to validate outputs independently
Comfortable supporting urgent, high-visibility reporting workstreams




Desirable

Experience with real-time or near-real-time reporting
Exposure to automation and scripting within reporting environments
Familiarity with NHS data quality standards, IG, and returns processes




This is a key support role on a critical project for an NHS trust currently behind on reporting obligations. You’ll play a direct role in helping them recover visibility across performance and compliance metrics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bionic:
Bionic is a tech-enabled business switching service. We empower small business owners with a radically better way for them to sort their business essentials through smart technology.    

We're currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us in a fast-paced environment where innovative ideas and projects come to life.  

About the Role:


Do you take satisfaction in seeing your recommendations implemented in the real world? Are you analytically creative and motivated by new challenges? Do you have a passion for working with data to drive insight and improve customer understanding? 

At Bionic, data is core to our business and strategy, and this role is part of a team that is critical to delivering on this goal.   

This role will build on the firm data and reporting architecture to bring insight, clarity and simplicity to what can be a complex business, ultimately making things simple for our customers.  As such you will leverage best in class analytics and data tools. 

You will have access to a wealth of data from a multitude of sources and will be translating analysis into commercially actionable insight and recommendations in a fast-paced environment.  The role will involve working on best practice statistical and analytical techniques to not only discover but also to test and measure impact of key strategic initiatives. 

You will be an important member of the Analytics team, with opportunities to interact cross functionally with Marketing, IT, Digital, Product, Commercial and Finance teams. 

Ultimately, this would be a great role for a Junior Analyst who is looking to take the next step to developing their skills in a fast growing Tech company. 



Day-to-Day:


Be a key member a small team of technical analysts, responsible for delivering business critical analysis and insight 
Be hands on in the coding of Bionic data to deliver analytical solutions to business problems and opportunities 
Be creative in supporting the development of analytical solutions to drive proven business value 
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, having the confidence to voice your thoughts and opinions  
Implementing rigorous testing and measurement: working on testing and measurement across products and functions, implementing methodologies to serve highly iterative and fast paced roadmap. 
Communicate analysis to drive engagement: Share analytical results in a commercial and compelling manner, with ability to visualise insights in a clear and concise format 
Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies: best in class techniques and application to real business problems 
Learn and help share knowledge to grow capability of the team and Bionic: ensure that learnings are shared within the team and the business to drive a data driven culture.  Actively participate in trainings, documentation of learnings and data/analytics sharing sessions


Essential Skills and Experience:


Confident User of SQL and Python 
Experience analysing large and complex datasets - Cloud-based data platforms preferred 
Understanding of statistical and data science techniques (e.g. forecasting, regression, clustering etc) to deliver business projects 
Experience in Data Visualisation (Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker) 
Degree level or higher in a numerate subject (e.g. Maths, Statistics, Economics, Operational Research or Computer Science) 
1-2 years' experience in a data analyst or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced commercial or digital environment. 


Who We're Looking For:


A commercially driven analyst for a Data and Analytics team passionate about driving business growth  
Ability to demonstrate an analytical ‘curiosity' through innovative, data driven insights about business questions 
Ability to explore business impact and position analysis to deliver commercial value 
A self-starter that is curious and keen to learn new approaches and techniques as well as demonstrate innovation in approach  
A keen sharer of information with the ability to translate analysis into insight and support delivery of compelling commercial recommendations 
Curious, proactive, ambitious, storyteller, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player 
Experience working in cross-functional teams (with product, commercial, marketing and IT) is preferrable  
It would be highly desirable if you had experience within one of the following: Digital, B2B, Retail and Customer Data




Interview process 


Initial conversation with one of our Talent Acquisition Team 
1st stage Teams interview with the hiring manager and a colleague from the Data Analytics team 
2nd stage in-person case study-based interview 


About the Bionic Group 


Bionic has over 600 colleagues working across three office locations and four businesses; Bionic - London (HQ), Bionic Outbound - Luton, Think Business Loans - Chelmsford, and Smart -our Field based agents. 

Working at Bionic means provides you many opportunities to advance your career, with incredible progression, recognition, and reward. 

Benefits  

Enhance your health & wellbeing 🌱 

Private healthcare cover 
Employee Assistance Programme, including a virtual GP service, priority physio & talking therapies 
Eyecare scheme 

Taking time away from work 🏖️ 

25 days annual leave plus the 8 UK bank holidays, increasing with tenure 
1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period 
1 paid charity volunteering day per year 
Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year 

Family matters: for the special moments 🏠 

Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave 
2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service 
Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach 

Financial wellbeing 💸 

Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme  
Life assurance 
Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure 
Cycle to work scheme 

Recognition 🌟 

Highflyers incentive, a VIP experience for our high performers across Bionic group to celebrate success 
Company summer & Christmas party celebrations, business and local zonely & annual awards and recognition  
Long service awards 

Show more

  • Private healthcare cover

  • 1 paid family/religious day of leave per year - following successful probation period 
  • 1 paid charity volunteering day per year 
  • Option to buy/sell up to an additional 3 days leave per year

  • Enhanced maternity, paternity or shared parental leave 
  • 2 days off for your wedding upon joining, and up to 5 days after 2 years' service 
  • Flexible working options & a hybrid work approach

  • Auto-enrolled salary sacrifice pension scheme  
  • Life assurance 
  • Season ticket Loans, salary advances & loans to buy/rent a home - based on tenure 
  • Cycle to work scheme
